loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis is a petty trader at the market at Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. She has been engaged in this venture since 2010. Her husband is a chain saw operator, and they both use their incomes to support their two children and to maintain family expenses. Mavis never had the opportunity to attend school.

Mavis would like to expand her business into the preparation and sale of fried doughnuts. She has requested a loan in order to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and gallons of oil, which she will use to prepare fried doughnuts to offer for sale. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Mavis intends to save money so that she can continue to diversify into different types of business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and gallons of oil, which she will use to prepare fried doughnuts to offer for sale

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence operates a tea shop in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. Lawrence has received education, but only to junior high school level. He is married and has five children. His wife is a food vendor. 

Lawrence has been operating the tea shop for three years now. He is responsible for all the financial needs of his family. His loan will be used to buy crates of eggs, tins of Milo, cartons of milk, and tins of coffee. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save towards his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy crates of eggs, tins of Milo, cartons of milk, and tins of coffee.

loans.name: Néstor Iván

texts.es: Néstor vive en casa propia con su familia, Él se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijoles y tambien de caña de azúcar desde hace varios años, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir los gastos de sus hogar y tambien poder llevar el pan de cada dia. Néstor es un hombre muy trabajador, dinámico y responsable del cual muchas personas dan buenas referencias. Desea poder  invertir  un poco más en la agricultura con el fin de cosechar una mayor cantidad de granos básicos que le permitan mejorar sus ventas como sus ingresos, por eso solicita un crédito para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: semilla, abonos, venenos para plagas, etc. y para mejorar su terreno que muestra la fotografia para tener mejores cosechas y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Néstor lives in his own home with his family. He has been growing crops, such as corn, beans, and sugar cane for several years. With the profit he generates from his sales, Néstor is able to cover the household expenses and also provide for daily needs. He is a hardworking, dynamic, and responsible man who has received good references from several other people.

Néstor wants to invest a little more into his farming so that he can achieve a larger harvest from his basic crops. This will enable him to improve his sales and his income. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of needed supplies such as seeds, compost, pesticides, and other items. He will also pay for improvements to his land, as shown in the photograph, so that he will have a larger harvest and better living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, pesticides, and other items, as well as pay for improvements to his farmland.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. He has six children and has been doing this work (farming) for eight years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "dairy farming!" His biggest challenge is: "drought." Animals on the farm have not been named.

David was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "saw my neighbors succeed with Juhudi."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "the importance of farming as a business."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, "how will this loan benefit your family?," David replied, "better quality of life."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. David owns the following: 'cow, poultry,' but does not own: 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, running water,' but does not have: 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalimu is married and has three children, all of whom attend school.  For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from her home to her neighbous and passersby. 

Mesalimu is requesting a loan from Yehu for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To change the tarps and buy chairs and tables for her food stall.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is divorced and has four children. She is a petty trader at Likpe Bakua, Hohoe, which she has been doing for 28 years.   

Christian is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy palm trees. She is responsible for all the general upkeep of her children. She hopes to use the new profits from his business to save towards giving her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase palm trees.

loans.name: Miguel Agustin

texts.en:
My name is Miguel, I am 28 years old. I am a very responsible, hard working person, friendly person. I like sports and reading. I like to get ahead,  own my things and grow as a baker. I started my bakery 12 years ago, after finishing a technical degree in accounting. Since I was 15 years old, I worked as a "chalan" (low level assistant) in a bakery. Slowly but surely I began saving some money, then I bought some fixed assets: machines and an oven and all the required utensils for the bakery. I started my bakery on a tricycle and have been growing my business since.

I own a "local" (a roofed space in a market)and have two workers, I baked the bread at home and sell it in the bakery that is located inside the mercado solidario.

The name of the bakery is Sondury and my slogan is "Quality in my bread".

I bake the bread in my house from 5 AM to noon, prepare the dough, cook the bread, decorate it and prepared to sell. My uncle helps me, and I pay him a salary.  I open the bakery from 7AM to 11.30 AM and then from 4.30 PM to 9.30 PM.

loans.use: To pay for flour, eggs and butter, to increase bread production for the rainy season.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.en:
My name is Eloy, I live in Iztapalapa, one of the eastern boroughs of Mexico City.

I am 31 years old and have been married for 9 years with my wife, Hortencia. I have 4 sons, ages 12,9, 6 and an older one that is 21 years old (from my wife previous marriage, but that I consider like my own son).

For the last 9 years, I have dedicated my life to working with the idea of providing a better future for my family, I know that is a step by step process, but in the end it is for my kids future.

I own a business that is called Azulejos Iztlahuacan. I work with my wife, we sell tiles, blinds, bath sets, etc. My wife sells in our store and I do the installation in our clients homes.  We have been in business for 9 years.

I consider myself credit worthy, because I always pay my loans on time.

My biggest accomplishment is providing stability for my family and my biggest goal is to grow my business and increase my wealth.

loans.use: To buy tiles, glue,materials and other inventory for his business.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
My name is Manuel, I am 45 years old and live in San Miguel Teotongo. I am a widower.

I live in a house with my daughter who will soon be 18, my son who is 13, and my mother who is an old person. My mother helps me take care of my sons. 

I would like to mention that on one hand,  I´m an excellent baker and in the other that my sons are excellent students. My biggest accomplishment is that I have been able to take care of my children and my mother.

My bakery is called, Amparito, that is the name of my mother, and I want to be known as the best baker in the neighborhood.

I have been baking bread for over 25 years, I purchase the inputs in large quantities and later bake chocolate and sugar donuts and sell them in the street of my neighbourhood. I also earn additional income by working as a mason and blacksmith.

loans.use: reopen his bakery by financing the fixing of his shop and inputs to bake bread.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
My name is Rita, I am 40 years old. I am married and live with my family.

I started my business 19 years ago, I am an entrepreneur, love sales, innovation and consider myself a very creative person.

My business consist on retail sales: gifts, cosmetics and accessories for woman, I sell by catalog and manage a network of 40 woman, I earn commission on their sales. With my savings I was able to buy a taxi, that my husband drives to provide additional income for my family. 

My biggest accomplishment is to have formed and lead a large group of sales woman in Terramar and Mary Kay Cosmetics. 

I need the loan for the taxi plates, which will help my husband as he will be able to bring extra income. The rest will be used to buy cosmetics - as selling cosmetics is my main activity.

loans.use: renew the license of my husband's taxi and buy cosmetics and women accessories for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Mujeres Emprendedoras, son un grupo compuesto por 5 mujeres que como su nombre lo dice, quieren emprender sus negocios para salir a delante con sus familias. María de Jesús es una de las integrantes del grupo, es casada, tiene 5 hijos y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza; inicio vendiendo perfumes a sus vecinas y ahora también vende cosméticos y productos por catalogo, ya que le deja mas ganancias y de esa forma puede ayudar mas a su esposo con los gastos en su casa. Su sueño es vender mucho y poder ganarse un carro con los puntos que le otorgan en la compañía donde está. Sus compañeras la describen como una persona cumplidora, responsable y luchista.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) is a group that consists of five ladies. As their name suggests, they want to launch their businesses so that they can move forward along with their families.

María de Jesús is one of the group members. She is married and has five children. María de Jesús sells beauty products. She started out selling perfumes to her neighbors and now she sells cosmetics and other products through catalogs. As a result, she earns more income and is able to help her husband even more with the household expenses. Her dream is to sell more and be able to buy a car with the points that are rewarded by her company. Her fellow group members describe her as a reliable, responsible, and determined individual.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Compressor Group

texts.en:
Sarah is in her late 30s, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  For four years, Sarah has been running a retail shop selling different items like sugar, beans, and other consumable and durable items. She also sells charcoal. She works from 6 AM to 10 PM daily and is able to make a good profit every month. 

Sarah is requesting her 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to purchase sugar and beans. With the previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, she purchased shop items, restocked charcoal, and bought two big tanks for water selling. The profit covered home expenses and school fees. Sarah dreams of building a nice house for her family. 

Sarah will share this loan with her loan group Compressor, which totals 10 members . The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans.

loans.name: Luis Esteban

texts.es: Luis Esteban de 56 años de edad, casado, habitante de Chinandega, ubicado en la zona del occidente del país y tiene un hijo menor de edad a su cargo, donde con mucho esfuerzo le apoya, para asistir a sus estudios primarios , Don Luis se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación, le brinda su servicio como Guarda de seguridad de una finca bananera, y su esposa labora como enfermera auxiliar, solicita que se le de otra oportunidad de adquirir un préstamo, para construir un cuarto, para esto necesita comprar materiales de construcción como son: Hierro, clavos, cemento, arena, zinc, pintura, entre otros detalles, es por esto que solicita este préstamo, para seguir  ampliando  su casa de habitación. Don Luis esteban se encuentra muy agradecido con la oportunidad crediticia, que se le ha brindado por parte de los inversionistas Kivas y la atención que se le da en el proceso del crédito.
texts.en: Luis Esteban, 56, is married and a resident of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. He has a dependent child for whom he works very hard to support, so that he can attend primary school. Luis is known for being a hardworking and responsible man with a great desire to improve himself. He provides his services as a security guard for a banana plantation, and his wife works as an auxiliary nurse. He is applying for another loan to build a room. He needs to buy construction materials for this such as iron, nails, cement, sand, zinc, and paint, among others. This is why he is applying for this loan: to continue expanding his home. Luis is very grateful for this credit opportunity provided to him by Kiva lenders and the attention given to him in the credit process.

loans.use: to build an additional room in his home.

loans.name: Yosofu

texts.en:
Yosofu used the previous loan to buy sugar and soap to sell. He is a 25-year-old, hardworking man who lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for a year. He earned his start-up capital from a coffee-sales business, which he still operates. He started the retail shop to supplement his income from the coffee business, which is seasonal and cannot sustain the needs of his family year-round.

He dreams of educating his children and expanding his businesses to new areas. He faces business challenges, such as stiff competition and price fluctuations. Yosofu is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt and cooking oil, to sell at his shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and cooking oil, to sell at his shop.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi, de 41 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos por quienes trabaja arduamente para brindarles todo lo que necesitan y vive en su casa propia. Elabora paquetes de condimentos como guisantes, pimienta, cominos, laurel, canela y otros que envasa en bolsas pequeñas para su posterior venta. Su trabajo se inicia a diario desde muy temprano recorriendo cada uno de los puestos de ventas ubicados en los principales mercados para ofrecer sus productos al por mayor. Generalmente vende a crédito y realiza la cobranza de manera semanal. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 1 año y desde que empezó lo ha hecho sola. También alquila un mototaxi y con ello asegura sus ingresos económicos diarios.Todo las actividades laborales que realiza le brindan la tranquilidad y comodidad que necesita, ya que en este tiempo que lleva trabajando a logrado ganar un buen numero de clientes que constantemente solicitan sus productos y eso le genera buenas ventas, espera seguir trabajando mucho para poder hacer crecer su negocio de la mano con su economía.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600 soles, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. 
Con el monto solicitado comprará bolsas, clavo de olor, canela, hojas de laurel, guisantes, pimienta y comino en gran cantidad para venderlos al menudeo.
texts.en:
Deysi, 41, is single and has two children.  She works hard to give them everything they need.  She lives in her own house.

She prepares packets of peas, pepper, cumin, bay leaves, cinnamon, and other seasonings that she packages in small bags to sell.  Every day she starts working very early, going to each one of the sales stalls in the main markets to sell her products wholesale.  Generally she sells on credit and collects weekly.  She has been doing this work for a year and she has done it alone since the beginning.  She also rents a motorcycle taxi, which guarantees her daily income.

All the jobs she does give her the peace and comfort she needs, because in the time she has worked she has managed to acquire a good number of customers who constantly request her products.  This generates good sales for her.  She hopes to continue working a lot to be able to make her business grow hand in hand with her finances.

Currently she'll request 600 soles [PEN].  She's very happy to know she'll have some financial support because she'll always feel certain of making progress with her business.

With the requested amount she'll buy bags, cloves, cinnamon, bay leaves, peas, pepper, and cumin in bulk to sell retail.

loans.use: to buy cinnamon, cloves, and other seasonings

loans.name: Binti Suleiman

texts.en:
Binti Suleiman is a married woman, who has four children. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Binti Suleiman operates a food-making business, making comestibles like beans and chapati (flat bread), for sale to passersby and neighbours. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase food items, including wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business, to earn more income, and establishing a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, including wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Doña Maria de 56 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa desde hace 5 años, vive con su esposo que es agricultor en casa propia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña maria necesita hacerle una mejora a su vivienda ya que con lo que gana no le es suficiente para realizarlo por eso solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar los materiales que necesita como, cemento, arena, hierro, entre otras cosas para hacerle algunos cambios a su vivienda para que su esposo y ella puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en:
Doña Maria has been selling all types of clothing for five years. She lives in her own home with her husband, who is a farmer. With the income she generates from her sales and the money that her husband earns, they are able to pay for some of their household expenses.

Doña Maria needs to make an improvement to her home, but the income she earns is not sufficient to pay for this project. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to buy the materials she needs such as cement, sand, iron, and other supplies. By making a few changes to their home, she and her husband will be able to live more securely.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, and other supplies for making home improvements.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is from the village of Antonino. She is 36 years old and is married with two children. Though she is a teacher at a government school, still she is engaged in her food stall for additional income. She has been in this business for almost two years. To this end, Gloria is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to buy kitchen utensils, chicken meat, pork and vegetables to cook and sell. Gloria hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, chicken meat, pork and vegetables to cook and sell

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en: Apolinario is 56 years old and happily married to Solmira. One of his primary sources of income is a hog-raising business. He has been doing this for almost seven years. Apolinario wants to improve his hog-raising business, so he is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 32,000 to buy feed and vaccines. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to maintain the proper growth of his hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines

loans.name: Stanislove

texts.en:
Stanislove is single. He has received schooling through basic level, to tertiary. Stanislove is a photographer, and he also sells drinks at a market in Hohoe, which he has done for the past 20 years. Stanislove uses his income for all his personal needs and those of his younger brother.

Stanislove will use the loan to purchase a camera. With the new profits from his expanded business, Stanislove plans to save, to enable him to give a new look to his drinking business place.

loans.use: to purchase a camera.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for snacks and chicken meat, pork and vegetables to cook for meals to sell

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to stock for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to stock for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has five children. Margaret is a petty trader in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe, which she has done since 2008. Her husband is also a petty trader. Margaret uses her income to assist the husband with the basic needs of the family. 

Margaret will use the loan to purchase bags of charcoal, so she can continue to deal in the sales of charcoal and local rice. With the new profits from her expanded business, Margaret plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal, so she can continue to deal in the sales of charcoal and local rice.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel sells grains as a petty trader in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. Emmanuel has received education to the middle school level.  He is married and has three children. His wife is a petty trader. 

Emmanuel has been in petty trading for the past 20 years. He is responsible for all the financial needs of his home. His loan will be used to buy and sell grain (maize, rice). He intends to use the new profits from his expanded business to save for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy and sell grain (maize, rice)

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a hardworking woman, aged 29, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. In order to raise income for the family, she decided to venture into selling clothing, and the business has been very lucrative. The ever-changing customer preferences, coupled with inadequate capital, affect her profits. Her dreams are to own a modern boutique and to educate her children up to the University level. Margret intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia, who previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help toward her children's education and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Lila is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed for sale, the better profit she can earn, which will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilia dreams that her children will finish their education and hopes that her business will continue to expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
Jhona is a 29-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is a mother of fpur school-aged children. The oldest child is 11 while the youngest is two. She buys and sells various utensils. She has been selling utensils for almost one year. Her husband works as a driver. His income is not enough for the family's daily needs. 

Jhona requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more  various  kitchen utensils like pans, ladles and spatulas. In the future, Jhona would like to expand her business as well  as save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more  various  kitchen utensils like pans, ladles and spatulas

loans.name: Sronipah

texts.en:
Sronipah  is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Sronipah sells soap in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. She has been hawking and selling soaps in the community for the past six years. Her husband is a carpenter.

Sronipah uses her income to help her husband with the basic necessities of the house. Sronipah will use the loan to purchase varieties of soap. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sronipah plans to save to increase her working capital so she can do other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of soap.

loans.name: 25 De Julio 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE JULIO 2”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Egberta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugos de linaza, pintura de madera, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de faldas, costura de chamarras, costura de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Egberta es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de faldas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el primer préstamo obtenido en Pro Mujer y en la actualidad le va yendo muy bien.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de faldas) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene  tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “25 de Julio 2” (July 25th #2) is starting its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Egberta as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling linseed juice, painting wood, managing a neighborhood store, selling food, selling skirts, sewing jackets, and sewing satchels.

This loan will benefit small businesswomen such as Sra. Egberta. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is also a member of the organization. Egberta currently has a business of selling skirts. She learned about this business and then started her own with the first loan she received from Pro Mujer. At the moment, she is doing very well.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying skirts. She acquires her goods from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and then sells them from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to maintain her household. Egberta is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Egberta said that she enjoys the training sessions about health and credit.

loans.use: to buy skirts.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon, age 61, is a farmer and a vendor of agricultural produce. He farms banana and sugar cane as well as other crops, and his customers are wholesalers from the city. 

Benon lives with his wife and children in Fort Portal, Uganda. His primary objective is to bring in a good income so that he can support his family and eventually provide for his children's higher education.

The current rainy seasons often make the roads impassable, and floods are also a great threat to his business. His desire is eventually to own a food store in town. 

Benon intends to use the loan to buy ground-nuts and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy ground-nuts and maize to offer for sale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. He has four children and has been doing farming for 11 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "dairy farming." His biggest challenge is: "disease control."

Julius was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "efficiency in their services."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "records-keeping."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, "how will this loan benefit his family?," Julius replied, "it will help me get better schools for the children."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Julius owns the following: 'cow, poultry, automobile,' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle.' 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net,' but does not have: 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Jose Gustavo

texts.es: El señor Jose Gustavo . tiene  más de 2  años dedicándose a  dar  mantenimiento y reparación a  Casa-habitación  desde impermeabilizar la casa,  pintura  hacer una fachada o decoracion al domicilio y lo que le pida el cliente . Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso para el y su familia, esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio ya que le está  haciendo falta mas variedad de material  y herramienta  como  escaleras,  gama de pinturas y una soldadora . Pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar a cabo la inversión,   es por eso que esta solicitando   este crédito para poder comprar el material que  le esta faltando y asi poder dar una mejor calidad de trabajo a sus clientes . Planea pagar el préstamo con una parte de las ganancias  del negocio.
texts.en:
Jose Gustavo has been making a living by maintaining and repairing houses for two years. His work includes waterproofing houses, painting, constructing the outside walls of buildings, and decorating homes, depending on what the client asks for. This business is a source of income for him and his family. 

He is applying for a loan to invest in his business, since he lacks variety in his materials and tools, such as ladders, a range of paint, and a welding machine. At the moment, he does not have the necessary money to make this investment, which is why he has applied for a loan to buy the material which he lacks. He will then be able to offer his clients a better quality job. He plans to pay back this loan with part of his earnings from his business.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools, such as ladders, paint, and a welding machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more equipment and acquire a larger space

loans.name: Josept  Natali

texts.es:
Natali  tiene 20 años de edad   es soltera tiene una hija vive con su hija en el cantón Chillanes Provincia 

Bolívar. 




Es integrante de ventanilla Unión Central Parroquia San José del  Tambo actividad económica agricultura, 

crianza de animales  y comercio la comunidad se encuentra a una hora de la cooperativa.



Natali se dedica a la venta de ropa. 


Solicita el crédito para comprar ropa y luego volver a vender.  


Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Babahoyo.  



Su sueño es tener un negocio propio.  



No tiene ningún desafío  que enfrentar.   



En su tiempo libre le gusta ver películas.
texts.en:
Natali is twenty years old. She is single and has a daughter. She lives with his daughter in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar Province. 

She belongs to the communal bank Unión Central, in the parish of San José del Tambo. Its members work farming, raising animals, and selling merchandise. His community is located one hour from the co-op.

Natali works selling clothing. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase clothing to resell. She makes his purchases in the town of Babahoyo. His dream is to have his own business. She doesn't face any challenges. In his free time, she enjoys watching movies.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por   socios responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito de ate Vitarte. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “Mujeres Activas” una de ellas es la Sra. Jacinta   de 53 años de edad soltera y con 4  hijos, la Sra. Jacinta  se dedica ya hace 26  años a la venta de verduras (abarrotes, papas, choclos, cebollas  etc.)  En un pequeña bodega  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos y pagar los gastos de su casa, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  que la Sra. Jacinta   trabaja mucho, Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más verduras  y así poder tener más ingresos. La Sra. Jacinta es la primera de  la mano izquierda con blusa morada ,   A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y  diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en:
This group consists of responsible individuals who engage in different commercial activities. All of them reside in the District of Vitarte and are members of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women).

One of the members is Sra. Jacinta. She is 53 years old, single, and has four children. Sra. Jacinta has been selling vegetables (potatoes, corn, onions, as well as groceries) for 26 years. By working at her small store every day, Jacinta is able to move forward by paying for her children’s schooling and the household expenses. Her greatest wish is to see her children become professionals. For this reason, Sra. Jacinta works very hard. The loan she is receiving will be invested in the purchase of more vegetables so that she can have more income.

Sra. Jacinta is the first person on the left-hand side (from the group’s perspective) who is wearing a purple blouse. She bids farewell with a hug to Kiva and says that she plans to accomplish all of her goals.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Milton Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén tiene 45 años de edad es casado tiene una hija vive con su esposa e hija en el Cantón  Chimbo Provincia Bolívar.

Rubén  trabaja en  una empresa  de productos agricolas. 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de un plasma para el hogar. 

La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Guaranda. 
 Su sueño es seguir trabajando para mejorar la estabilidad de la familia. 
 El desafío que enfrenta es vivir bien en la familia y sin deudas. 
En su tiempo libre le gusta pasear con la esposa e hija.
texts.en:
Rubén is 45 years old, married, and has a daughter.  He lives with his wife and daughter in the canton of Chimbo, which is in Bolívar Province.

Rubén works for an agricultural products company.  He is requesting a loan in order to buy a plasma TV for his home.  This item will be purchased in the city of Guaranda.  

His dream is to continue working so that he can improve his family’s stability.  The challenge he faces is being able to live well with his family without any debts.  In his free time, Rubén enjoys going out for walks with his wife and daughter.

loans.use: to buy a plasma TV for his home.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a food vendor at Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. She is divorced and has one child. Justine has been cooking and selling beans with plantains for the past 20 years at the market. She is responsible for all the financial needs of herself and her child. Her loan will be used to buy bags of beans, bunches of plantains, bags of 'gari' (cassava couscous), and gallons of palm oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her child's education since she couldn’t attend school herself and now knows the importance of schooling.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans, bunches of plantains, bags of 'gari', and gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Philippine

texts.en:
Philippine is married and has two children. She has never received any formal education. Philippine is a petty trader at Likpe Bakua, Hohoe, which she has done for 3 years. Her husband is an electrician. Philippine uses her income to assist her husband with the basic necessities of the home. 

Philippine will use the loan to purchase and sell bread. With the new profits from her expanded business, Philippine plans to save and reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to purchase and sell bread.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman, and she lives together with her husband and eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seventeen years, she has operated a business selling charcoal. She sells from home, to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge, the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business, to become a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
For more than 10 years, Mwanaisha has operated a cereal shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Mwanaisha dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy, age 61, earns an income as a housekeeper. She lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Her husband, a soldier, earns $3 daily. Three of their children are employed in a local factory and earn $16 per day.

Due to lack of funds, Savy is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000, which she will use to purchase construction materials to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. 

In the future, she would like to run an additional business and ensure her youngest child's access to higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair the family house

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon, age 28, lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. For the past five years, he has cultivated bananas to support the needs of his only child. He earns an income of PHP 5,000 a month from this business. For a young father, there’s nothing that can make him happier than to see his family in a good living situation. 

Marlon has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. He is a new client with GDMPC. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan es un señor casado de 47 años quien  tiene tres  hijos un hombre y dos mujeres y viven en Sololá.
Actualmente se dedica a la compraventa de frutas preparadas en bolsas, donde sale a ofrecer a las diferentes calles. Esta actividad lo viene realizando desde hace dos años ya que le genera ganancias aceptables y es así como puede cubrir los gastos familiares. 
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para capital de trabajo para la compraventa de frutas y de esta manera poder ampliar su negocio y ofrecerles una gran variedad de frutas a sus clientes con la finalidad de mejorar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es tener un local en donde pueda tener su negocio y  brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is a 47-year old man, married and father of three children, two girls and one boy. They live in Sololá. He currently makes a living from buying and selling ready-to-eat fruit in the streets. He has been working on this activity for two years as it provides him with acceptable earnings and allows him to cover his household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000 GTQ to build work capital for buying and selling fruit. This way he will be able to expand the business, offer a broad variety of fruits to his clients and improve his income. His dream is to have a store and to provide a better service to his clients.

loans.use: to build work capital for buying and selling fruit.

loans.name: Ingrid Katherin

texts.es:
Su nombre es Ingrid, vive con su madre trabaja entre semana  y cuidando un niño de 4 años con discapacidad, estudia los fines de semana, y su hermana Zharick estudiante cursando grado séptimo viven las tres en un conjunto,  su madre trabaja para el sustento diario de ellas tres y el de la casa. 

Desde muy pequeña ha sido muy interactiva creativa y extravagante tiene como hobbies,  el canto y la música aunque no los practica mucho por falta de tiempo y de dinero toma mucha practica y dedicación.  

Tiene como metas a corto plazo terminar sus estudios con muy buenas calificaciones para tener mejores posibilidades de estudiar en una universidad o quedar con trabajo gracias a la oportunidad de desarrollar un programa técnico laboral,  en las practicas seguir ayudándola a su madre en la casa y a su hermana en los estudios, tiene como metas a largo plazo terminar la universidad saber otro idioma tener algo de estabilidad  en cuanto a trabajo y dinero colaborar le en lo que mas pueda a su mama y poder viajar y conocer que mas depara el futuro .

Gracias por tomarse el tiempo de conocer un poco de su vida y de lo que quiere hacer también agradecer la oportunidad que le quiere brindar como dice un sabio refrán “lo que nunca sobrara es el estudio”    y ustedes están permitiendo que sus estudios sean parte de su estabilidad en el futuro
texts.en:
Her name is Ingrid, and she lives with her mother.  She works during the week and cares for a 4-year old boy with disabilities, and studies during the weekends.  Her sister Zharick is a secondary school student, in the seventh grade.  The three of them live together.  Her mother works to support the three of them and for the upkeep of the house.  

Since a young age, she has been very interactive, creative and extravagant.  Her hobbies are singing and music, although she doesn't engage much in them due to a lack of time and money.  They require a lot of practice and dedication.  

Her short-term goals are to finish her studies with good grades so that she can have better possibilities to study at a university or get a job thanks to the opportunity to enroll in a technical training program.  She would also like to continue helping her mother at home and her sister with her studies.  Her long-term goals are to finish university, learn another language, have some stability with regards to work and money, help her mother out as much as she can, and to be able to travel and know more about what the future holds.

Thank you for taking the time to hear a little about her life and what she wants to do.  Thank you also for offering her the opportunity.  As the wise saying goes, "an education is never a waste," and you are allowing her studies to be part of her future stability.

loans.use: to finish her program in business administration.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is a 39-year-old hardworking married woman with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a piggery business that has been very lucrative since the rate of multiplication is high. One pig can give birth to 24 piglets in a year. The high cost of feed and inadequate capital are her major challenges while her dreams are educating her children and venturing into modern methods of farming. Teddy intends to use the loan to buy exotic pigs to raise.

loans.use: to buy exotic pigs to raise.

loans.name: Mwende

texts.en:
Mwende is a married woman with one child who attends school and is under her care. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For over three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, that she wants to purchase a bale of childrens' clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of childrens' clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira, age 42, is a homemaker living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, six sons, and two daughters. Her husband is a diabetic patient and she worries constantly about his health. He supports the family by operating a wood shop, which is the only source of income for the family. All six sons work hard to assist their father in his business. 
 
Tahira has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan in order to help her husband in his business. The loan funds will allow them to purchase a wood machine and some wood material for the shop. With the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business, and with the expected profit he intends to open a new shop for his son.

Tahira dreams of her children's bright futures and prays for her husband's good health. She would like to say that BRAC is doing good work in the field of microfinance and that she is very thankful to BRAC and Kiva for helping her.

loans.use: to purchase a wood machine for the family business

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell. He is a 60-year-old, married man, who lives in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and to buy a car. He has been dealing in the sale of clothes for the past nine years. His major hardship is finding customers. He has a goal of expanding his business to new markets and setting up a modern boutique. Jackson needs the loan to buy clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
This is Angelyn who previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy diesel fuel to sell. Her earnings were a big help in meeting her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy more diesel needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angelyn dreams that her business will continue to grow and expand. She hopes that her family is always in good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories about her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for diesel needed in her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a single mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Gladys operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

With the loan of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for transport

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more grocery items for her grocery store and she was able to earn more income. It helped with her household expenditures as well as in her children's education. She and her husband are working for their family's future. They also sell ready-to-wear clothes and silver.

Milagros would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Milagros is dreaming of continuous growth in her business and a good life for her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Flor Del Valle I Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DEL VALLE I” iniciará el vigésimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dionicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tienda de abarrotes, venta de sombreros, costura de busos, carpintería, zapatería, venta de frescos, venta de café.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dionicia es integrante, ella indica que hace veinte años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el primer préstamo que se hizo de Pro Mujer y con mucho esfuerzo, lo que en la actualidad le dio ganancias.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, fideo) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, las capacitaciones, el área de salud y los ahorros
texts.en:
The "Flor del Valle I" communal bank is entering its twenty-ninth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional hub. The group is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors, of which Dionicia is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include food sales, a grocery store, hat sales, sewing sweatshirts, carpentry, a shoe shop, soft drinks sales, and coffee sales.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Dionicia, who says that she joined Pro Mujer twenty years ago by the invitation of a friend who is a partner of the institution. She currently has a business selling food. She says that she started this business with her first loan from Pro Mujer and that with plenty of effort, she has earned a profit.

She will use this loan to increase her working capital by buying rice, oil, and noodles from wholesale distributors. After making the food, she will sell it from her business space. This type of work allows her to generate an income to maintain her home as much as possible, since she is married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loans, the workshops, the health initiatives, and the savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
This is Jackline. She operates a business selling ladies' shoes. In addition, she operates a food-vending business. Her earnings have been a big help for the education of her children, and in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She is asking for another Kiva loan of KES 40,000. She will use it to buy additional women's shoes. The more items displayed at her shoe business, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs and the education of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase, with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jackline dreams that her children will finish their studies, and she hopes to expand her business again. She appreciates the help.

loans.use: to buy additional women's shoes.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El señor Alberto, de 33 años de edad, actualmente vive en concubinato, vive en la casa de su cuñado, alcanzo a estudiar hasta bachillerato, cuenta con tres dependientes económicos los cuales son sus hijos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica el señor Alberto es el servicio de portería en una escuela, pero también se dedica a la actividad agrícola que anualmente produce: papa y haba, esta actividad agrícola la desarrolla en los terrenos de sus padres que están ubicados en la comunidad de Cochimita Tiraque. El Señor Alberto manifiesta ser una persona con aspiraciones de superarse económicamente en la vida y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de operación para compra de mercadería para su tienda de su concubina, la cual se dedica a la venta de alimentos como ser: galletas, masticables, refrescos y otros; la venta lo realiza  en una tienda que está ubicada dentro del colegio, de tal forma la pareja con sus distintas actividades mejoran sus ingresos por lo tanto también la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en:
Alberto, 33, currently lives with his partner in his brother-in-law's house.  He studied up to high school.  He has three dependents, his children.

Alberto provides porter services for a school.  He also works in agriculture, growing potatoes and beans annually.  He carries out this agricultural activity on his parents' land in the community of Cochimita Tiraque.

Alberto shows himself to be someone who wants to improve himself economically in life, and for this he needs to request operating capital to buy merchandise for his partner's store.  She makes a living selling food such as cookies, gum, soft drinks, and other things.  She makes her sales in a store located inside the school, so with their various activities the couple improves their income as well as the quality of life of their dependents.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope is a 40-year-old hardworking single mother of two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a tea plantation alongside a business selling coffee husks and cocoa chaff. She began the business to employ herself and also raise school fees for her children. Her dreams are to expand her plantation and to set up a retail shop to meet her family daily expenses and overcome challenges of bad weather and inadequate capital. Hope intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay her workers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay her workers.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 48-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children. The oldest child is 21 while the youngest is eight. She is engaged in a food vending business. She  sells hot cakes. She has been selling snack foods for almost 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients  such as flour, sugar, mayonnaise and  butter. This will help Miriam's business to survive, especially as the income is such a great help, especially in the family's daily needs.  

In the future, Miriam would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to send all her children for college education.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients  such as flour, sugar, mayonnaise, and  butter

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a 34-year-old married woman and  a mother of three children from Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than six years now together with her husband. This is the source of their income. 

Analie is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. This loan will help her husband in augmenting his catch.

In the future, Analie has hopes of making their business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha operates a food vending business in which she cooks and sells chapati (flat bread), rice, and beans. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, which she has now maintained with the help of her previous Kiva loan. Her primary business challenge is seasonality. She earns an additional income from selling clothes.

She is requesting a new loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of Kes 40,000, which she will use to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour for her food vending business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour for her food vending business

loans.name: Edgar Franklin

texts.es: Edgar es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su trabajo y familia, él es responsable de sus tres hermanos menores de edad, por quien se esfuerza para salir adelante, Edgar trabaja sembrando maíz y frijoles, actividad que realiza junto a dos de sus hermanos, cuando su cosecha esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarla en mercados y en diferentes agencias que distribuyen granos básicos. El mayor deseo de Edgar es poder aumentar sus ventas ya que este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos que posee para brindarles todo lo necesario a sus tres hermanos,por lo que solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar abono, insecticidas, pesticidas y otros insumos más para obtener una cosecha excelente y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica
texts.en: Edgar is a very hardworking and responsible person who is fully dedicated to his job and family. He is responsible for his three younger brothers for whom he works hard to move forward. Edgar grows corn and beans, an activity that he does together with two of his brothers. When the harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries appearing in the photo. He then sells it in markets and to several agencies that distribute basic grains. Edgar's greatest wish is to raise his sales since this business is the only source of income that he has to provide his three brothers with everything necessary. For this reason, he is applying for a loan that will allow him to buy manure, insecticides, pesticides, and other supplies in order to have an excellent harvest and to provide better financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers, manures, etc.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan es joven de 20 años quien vive en Sololá.
El se dedica a la venta de helados  y lo realiza  todos los días. Inicio esta labor desde los 8 años junto a su padre, es así como fue ganando experiencia  en este tipo de actividad ya que actualmente  cuenta con una carreta  propia de helados. Atreves de las ganancias aporta a la economía familiar.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,500.00 para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de helados.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para ofrecerle a sus clientes diferentes tipos de helados y así salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juan is a twenty-year-old young man living in Sololá.

He works selling ice cream and does so every day. He got started in this business when he was eight years old at his father's side. That is how he gradually gained experience in this sort of business, and currently he has his own ice cream cart. His earnings allow him to contribute to his family's income.

He is requesting a GTQ 2,500 loan to buy ingredients to make ice cream.

His dream is to expand his business so that he can offer his customers different kinds of ice cream and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making ice cream.

loans.name: Collanas De Uyuni Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COLLANAS DE UYUNI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vicenta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de chompas y chalecos, venta de tejidos, venta de autopartes, elaboración de ropa de bebe, venta de pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vicenta es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de autopartes; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió porque su esposo trabaja en un taller mecánico y ella decide comprar los repuestos para este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de autoparte) que adquirirá de la Ciudad de Oruro por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, las capacitaciones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The "Collanas de Uyuni" communal bank is beginning its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional hub. The group is made up of six members and is run by a board of directors, of which Vicenta is the president. The members' business activities are varied and include making sweaters and vests, selling woven fabric, selling auto parts, making baby clothing, and selling fish.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Vicenta. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago by the invitation of one of the institution's promoters, who visited her at home. She currently has a business selling auto parts. She says that she started this business because her husband works in a mechanic's workshop and she decided to buy the spare parts for this business.

She will use this loan to invest in working capital by buying wholesale auto parts in the city of Oruro. She will later sell them in her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate an income to maintain her home as much as possible, as she is married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loans, the workshops, and the savings.

loans.use: to buy auto parts.

loans.name: Jose Arnoldo

texts.es: José es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra los principales granos básicos como lo son, maíz y frijol cuando la cosecha ha pasado se dedica a trabajar de albañil. José desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y tambien para poder mejorar el terreno donde siembra para obtener mejores cosechas. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
José is very responsible with his household duties and has always been characterized for offering the best to his family. He currently lives with his wife. He is very hardworking and he has always carried out his work happily and with enthusiasm. He works as a farmer, planting basic grains such as corn and beans. Once the harvest season is over, he works as a construction worker.

José would like to increase his sales, which is why he visited the Integral office to apply for a loan. This loan will allow him to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and pesticide, among other products. He will also be able to improve the plot of land where he plants his crops, in order to have better harvests. He looks forward to this help, given that he does not have any other financial income. He will then continue bringing home the daily bread with no limitations.

loans.use: to improve his land and buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Don Roberto se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maiz y maicillo cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la va almacenando en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlos en agencias de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, Don Roberto esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en:
Roberto has been working in agriculture for several years, which has given him the necessary ability and knowledge to attend to his crops. His main crops are corn and sorghum. 

When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the silos shown in the photograph. He then goes out and sells them to basic grains agencies near his home. With the earnings from his sales, he helps with his family's expenses. He lives with his wife and his three children. 

Roberto is applying for a loan to buy farm supplies to help with sowing crops, such as manure, seeds, and fertilizer. He will then be able to earn a better income and continue helping with the household expenses with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a fish vendor. She has operated her fish sales business for over 10 years, selling her wares from her home to restaurant operators and passers-by. She cites seasonality and perishability as her primary business challenges, which can lead to losses. 

Dorothy and her husband have been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. The family lives in a house that they own. It has neither electricity nor piped water. 
 
With the Kshs 40,000 loan she has requested, Dorothy would like to purchase bundles of fish to offer for sale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Ilyos

texts.ru:
Ильёс  добрый и честный мужчина в возрасте 47 лет.  Он  женат имеет 5 детей.   Жена домохозяйка, дети пока не обзавелись своими семьями.   Ильес с самого детства занимается откормом скота и знает все преимущества  этого дела,старшие дети ему тоже помогают.  Дополнительно у них имеется небольшое дехканства но дохода от этого мало,поэтому Ильёс  старается  развивать свой бизнес по откорму скота.  Раз в две недели Ильёс выводит от кормленых скотов на рынок и продает по выгодной цене и сразу же покупает молодых скотов.  Этот вид деятельности ему очень нравиться,так как он сам очень любит животных. Его сын каждый день выводит скотов на пастбище которое находится немного далеко от их дома, отец  купил ему  коня и сыну немного легко так как раньше он ходил туда пешком.    
Ильёс планирует в этом году женить своего старшего сына, так как он уже взрослый.  Для этого он должен накопить нужную сумму чтобы с достоинством провести свадебное мероприятие.  Он обратился в Арванд чтобы получить кредит для увеличения поголовья скота.  
Ильёс очень надеется,что в Арванде ему помогут и на полученный кредит он сможет купить несколько голов скота и накопить нужную сумму для мероприятия сына.
texts.en: Ilyos is a kind and honest man who is 47 years old.  He is married and has 5 children.  His wife is a homemaker who raises the children who don't yet have their own families.  Since his childhood, Ilyos has worked fattening cattle and knows all the advantages of the industry.  His older children help him with the work.  Additionally, they have a small farm, but the income from it is very small.  Therefore, Ilyos is trying to expand his business fattening cattle.  Every two weeks, he takes his fattened cattle to a market and sells them at a premium.  He then immediately buys new, young cows.  He very much likes this part of his work since he loves animals.  Every day, Ilyos' son takes the animals to a pasture not far from their home.  He bought his son a horse which makes his son's job a bit easier since he had to do it on foot before.  Ilyos plans to marry off his oldest son who is already grown this year.  For this, he should save money to be able to provide worthy wedding celebrations.  He has turned to Arvand to take out a loan to increase his number of cattle.  Ilyos hopes that Arvand will help him and that with this loan, he will be able to buy a few head of cattle and save the needed amount for his son's celebration.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 26 years old and single. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a farm, where he grows bananas to sell. He has been in his business for over three years and earns 6,000 PHP every month.

He has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2011. Now, Rogelio has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. He will use it to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house, and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for the banana plants

loans.name: Zatoon

texts.en:
Zatoon is a 50-year-old responsible mother of 3 children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been operating a welding shop for ten years. Currently he needs a new welding machine and some new welding materials like iron rods, welding chemicals, etc. For that purpose, Zatoon has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can continue his business. Zatoon and her family are very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase welding materials

loans.name: Mtamakulanga Group

texts.en:
Mwera, who is in his late 20s, is married with two kids who are in school. Since 2008, Mwera has been running a chicken project where he grows them and, later on after growing, sells them to the hotels and other customers. He is doing fine in his project.This project enables him to obtain his family's basic needs.  He works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair profit per month. 

This will be his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy more chicks (about 500) to reach more customers. He dreams to have a better life.  

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mtamakulanga," which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicks (about 500) to reach more customers

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 41 and she lives with her husband and four children aged 10 to 22. Her son works as a workman and her husband is a taxi driver.

Sakina has been engaged in land cultivation for more than 8 years. Particularly, she cultivates tomatoes and cucumber. Her husband helps her to sell the gathered harvest locally, which is the main income for their family. It is very difficult for Sakina and her family to sustain the family and the agricultural income is very important to them.

She wants to improve her living conditions and to repair their house, as it is old and is in bad condition. Sakina wants to repair all the rooms. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 AZN to repair her house.
 
In this way she will be able to offer her children a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month she will make her payment on time. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: to repair all the rooms of the house

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru: Женщина, которая является хранительницей очага своего дома и опорой для своих детей, реализовала свою грандиозную идею, организовать новый бизнес. Шаходат много лет не имела источника дохода. Так как ее муж имеет маленький доход и не в состоянии обеспечить своих 2  детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Дети год за годом требуют больше благ, так как они развеваются вместе с развевающимся миром. Шаходат решила организовать бизнес купле продажей индустриальных товаров, то есть товары необходимые для домохозяйства.  Она долго искала помощь и наконец, она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Она организовала свой бизнес и теперь планирует развевать свой бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  1000  сомони для покупки товара. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shahodat is a woman who is the keeper of the hearth of her own home, a support of her children.  She reached her grandiose goal of starting her own business.  For many years, Shahodat did not have a source of income.  Her husband's income is small and he is unable to provide for his 2 children with all necessities of life.  Each year, the children require more and more as they began to venture out into the world.  Shahodat decided to start a business buying and industrial goods--everything needed for housekeeping.  She long searched for help and finally she found out about the course "To Get Ahead" offered by the Association of Business Women.  She successfully passed the course and felt she received a lot of positives ou of it.  After completing the course, she was awarded a certificate.  She startedher business and now plans to expand her activities.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy inventory.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy home products for a new business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman staying together with her husband and three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past eight years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the village. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent runs a business in which she sells tablecloths, bed sheets, and curtains to earn an income. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other operators as her major challenges. 

Milicent decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She has requested a loan in the amount of Kshs 15,000, which she will use to pay for medical coverage for her family. 

She thanks Kiva lenders and Yehu for helping her.

loans.use: to pay for medical coverage for her family

loans.name: Sakhavat

texts.en:
Sakhavat is 39 years old, married and the father of four children aged 5 to 14. His mother lives together with them. Sakhavat has secondary education.

He has worked in livestock breeding for a period of 16 years; more specifically he purchases and resells cattle. At the same time, he sells milk products. Sakhavat learned about agricultural activity from his own father.

The house the family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some necessary repairs, so he is requesting a loan of 600 AZN to purchase building materials. Using these, he will build the bathroom at his house, thus enabling his family to have more comfortable conditions. Sakhavat is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to build a bathroom at his house

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol, age 31, is a rice farmer. She has been growing and harvesting rice for three years. Her husband works as a security guard. Together, they support four children. The eldest child is 11 years old and the youngest is a one-year-old baby.

In order to ensure that her farming endeavor continues to provide a good livelihood, Mirasol has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 6,000. She will use the loan funds to buy fertilizers, which will help her grow healthy rice that can be harvested and sold on time. 

In the future, Mirasol hopes to expand her business in order to better support her family, and especially to ensure the education of her children.
