loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice field

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa, age 38, operates a small variety store to earn an income. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PhP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PhP 500 in sales every day.

Jesusa lives in Taguig, Philippines, with her husband Hamid and their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. They are both working to provide income for the family's everyday needs.

Jesusa is requesting a PhP25,000 loan in order to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Jesusa dreams of adding another source of income for the family. Her goal is to be able to provide her children with the opportunity to finish their studies. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Elisi is a member of the Riziki Group. She engages in a number of different activities that enable her to cover her family's living expenses. These enterprises include selling clothes door to door, running a tigo-pesa telephone money transfer businesses, and offering airtime credit for sale. She has been involved in these businesses for a period of six years now. She works from 10 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a small profit per month.

Elisi is in her early 30s. She and her husband have two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. 

This will be Elisi's twentieth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she has repaid successfully, she managed to buy more airtime credits, started up the money transfer business, and initiated a phone-charging venture by buying chargers and other equipment. With the profit she has received, she has covered her home expenses and has worked on building the family home. 

She will use this loan to increase her inventory in all her enterprises. She dreams of finishing the building of her house.

Elisi will share this loan with her loan group "Riziki," which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her inventory in a number of business enterprises, such as clothes vending, airtime sales, and telephone charging

loans.name: Channath

texts.en:
Channath, a 42-year-old married mother of three, lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $5 each day.

Channath is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy timber to fix her house, a purchase that will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to replace their current motorbike and help her children each earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase timber to fix her house.

loans.name: Fahmeeda

texts.en:
Fahmeeda, age 42, is a homemaker who lives with her family in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a welder by profession and has run a welding shop in the area for some time. This shop is the only source of income for the family. 

Fahmeeda has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan in order to purchase iron rods, soldering rods, welding rods, and welding machines for her husband's shop, as these items are almost depleted from the shop at this time. 

She is hopeful that the loan will be a positive and productive one for the business and for her family. 

She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase welding machines and variety of welding rods for her husband's shop

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera, age 46, is a homemaker who lives with her family in Lahore, Pakistan. She and her husband have four children. Her husband owns a general store at the market near their home. This store is the only source of income for the family. 

Her husband would like to purchase a variety of much-needed products for the store, including wheat, sugar, flour, rice, and beans. At the present time, however, he does not have the necessary capital to make these purchases. For this reason, his wife Sumera has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan in order to help her husband to purchase the necessary items. 

Sumera is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one her husband's shop and for the family. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy items such as wheat, sugar, flour, rice, and beans for her husband to offer for sale in his store

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio, age 63, owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. He sells items such as sugar, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, shampoos, and detergents. He lives with his wife in Talibon, Bohol. 

Lucio has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 4,000. He will use his loan funds to buy additional commodities to offer for sale, such as soft drinks, noodles, seasonings, and toiletry items. This investment will help Lucio attract more customers because he will be able to offer a wider variety of merchandise from which to choose. 

In the future, Lucio hopes to expand his business in order to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy items such as soft drinks, noodles, seasonings, and toiletry items to offer for sale

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran, age 21, is a homemaker living with her husband and their two children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a rubber-selling shop in the area, and it is the only source of income for the family. 

At present, Kiran's husband would like to purchase a molding machine for making rubber to offer for sale. He does not have sufficient capital at this time to make this investment, so Kiran has decided to request a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan in order to help her husband purchase the necessary machine. 

Kiran is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's shop and for the family. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a molding machine for making rubber

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Joktan is a member of the Trust Group. He is a carpenter and has been making a variety of types of furniture since 1989. He works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

Joktan is in his early forties. He and his wife have four children, all of whom are enrolled in school.

This will be Joktan's tenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which he has repaid successfully, he has bought larger quantities of wood and has made larger quantities of furniture, which he has then been able to sell to more clients. With the profit made, Joktan bought a plot of land, where he started building a house for the family. He also paid school fees and maintained home expenses. 

He will use this loan to buy more wood for his carpentry business. He dreams of finishing the construction of his house. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Trust," which totals nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more wood for his carpentry business

loans.name: Safargul

texts.en:
Safargul, age 34, is divorced with one child. She is an intelligent woman who is suffering financial hardship due to the fact that her ex-husband does not pay enough support to adequately ensure her child's well-being. 

For this reason, Safargul decided to start up a business. She pursued this goal by taking a course for women entrepreneurs called "To Get Ahead," which she completed, earning a certificate. She intends to organize a business offering computer services such as printing and copying. 

Safargul is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 somoni in order to buy paper and a printer so that she can start up her business. 

She is thankful for your support.

loans.use: To buy paper and a printer for organizing her new business

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet Zainab. She is in her late 30s, from Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with four children between the ages of 4 years and 15 years.  Three of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2005, Zainab established her food stand business within a busy market area. She began her business because she wanted to stop sitting at home as a housewife and wanted to create income to support her needs. She works at the business from 7:30am to 6:30pm, every day. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Zainab requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil, onions, tomato paste, and rice for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and to increase her business. In the future, Zainab plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, onions, tomato paste, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a dairy farmer. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. He has been engaged in this work for six years and lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. He has four children. 

He tells us that what he enjoys about farming is working with his dairy cows. His biggest challenges are pests and disease control.

Geoffrey was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Juhudi Kilimo is very efficient.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and he answered, 'How to develop a savings culture.'
 
Geoffrey's highest monthly expense is school fees for his children. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Geoffrey replied, 'It will give them a better quality of life.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Geoffrey owns a 'cow and poultry' but does not own 'a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower tells us that his household has 'a mosquito net and electricity' but does not have 'solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player.'
 
Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs diwn.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es: Don Jose de 48 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 12 años. El esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas para su cosecha y tambien para darle un mejor mantenimiento a su terreno que muetra en la fotografia ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
José, 48, has made a living in agriculture for 10 years.  He grows beans and corn, and with the sale of his harvests he manages to cover his household expenses.

He's a responsible, honest, and hardworking man.  He lives with his wife and three children, ages 16, 14, and 12.

He's requesting a loan to be able to buy agricultural inputs for his harvest and to take better care of his land, which is shown in the photograph, because he doesn't earn enough to cover those expenses.  This way he'll have better income and economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to improve his plot of land

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora wishes to start up a business in animal husbandry. She decided on this path because her husband does not earn enough income to adequately support the family. Therefore, she wishes to generate her own income with which to contribute to her family's finances. Her goal is to offer her four children a higher quality of life. When she starts up her animal husbandry venture, her husband will help her with the business. 
 
In preparation for initiating her business, Gulnora took a course for women entrepreneurs called ‘To Get Ahead.’ She learned many business skills and earned a certificate upon completion of the course. 

Gulnora is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD, which she will use to buy cattle to start up her new enterprise. 

She is thankful for your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for initiating her new animal husbandry business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 39-year-old married woman with seven children between the ages of two and 18. She is from Talibon, Bohol. For the past five years, Marissa has been raising hogs and she also earns additional income from providing cosmetology services. She has provided pedicures and manicures for almost ten years. Marissa’s husband works as a laborer at a private company in town. 

Marissa is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan to buy pig feed and materials for providing manicures and pedicures. In the future, she would like to expand her business to support her family as well as send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and materials for providing manicures and pedicures

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Fatmata from Jui in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with six children between the ages of 13 and 23. Two of Fatmata’s children are attending school. For the past 20 years, she has run a business selling dried fish within her community. Fatmata works 10 hours a day, seven days a week. Her business is her only source of income. Fatmata says that her main business challenge is transporting the fish from the wharf to her house. 

Fatmata is requesting a loan to buy fish, palm oil, and gari. She will use the extra income from her loan to increase her business and pay her children’s school fees. In the future, Fatmata plans to own a permanent business structure. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy fish, palm oil, and gari

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 33 years old and married with two children, ages 4 years and 8 years. She runs a wood business in Jui, in the eastern area of Freetown. One of her children is going to school.

She's been in this business for five years and sells wood at her house. She also earns income from a small-scale garden. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to run her business.

Marie requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more wood, alongside with foodstuff like palm oil and rice. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her change her status of living. 

In the future, she would like to change her business to a provision store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wood, alongside with foodstuff like palm oil and rice.

loans.name: Koma

texts.en: Koma is in her late 50s and lives in the Jui area of eastern Freetown. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is still in school. She opened a food-selling business 30 years ago to generate income to support and care for her family. The main items she sells are palm oil, salt and seasonings, and she works 12 hours a day, seven days a week. The main challenges she faces are a low income and the high cost of transportation. She is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell, and will use the additional income she earns to put money aside for her old age and to renovate her house. In the future, she plans to expand her stall into a food store. She expresses thanks for your support.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs such as palm oil, salt, onions and seasonings.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 50-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like soap, noodles, biscuits, soft drinks and dry goods. She has been operating a retail store business for almost ten years. Her husband works as a security guard. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more soft drinks, canned goods, condiments and soap to keep her store in full stock to avoid shortages.

In the future, Zenaida would like to be successful in her business to be able to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, canned goods, condiments and soap.

loans.name: Sento

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Sento from Jui in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of six months and 12 years. One of Sento’s children is currently attending school. She established a clothing business in 2003 to generate income and improve her standard of living. Sento works at her business every day, moving door to door to introduce her goods. Her main business challenge is a poor business location. 

Sento is requesting a loan to order more baby clothing, rubber bowls, and food containers. She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to have a permanent business location and increase her business. In the future, Sento plans to expand her business to a big general store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy baby clothing, rubber bowls, and food containers

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Marie from Jui in the eastern area of Freetown. She is a single mother blessed with one child, age 4 years. She began her business when she dropped out of school. She decided to start her business to create income to support her child. 

Marie runs a food stand business; she sells pepper, palm oil and fish. She has been running this business for nine years. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. every day. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Marie has requested a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs like palm oil, rice, fish and cooking seasoning for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve herself and her child. 

In the future, she plans to open a big general store. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs like palm oil, rice, fish and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Mt. Livingstone Group

texts.en:
Halima is in her late 30s and single with a girl who is in school. For the past year, she has been running a café where she sells water, soft drinks, and some kinds of food. Halima works from seven in the morning through 10 at night and is able to make a good monthly profit. She is doing fine. Halima has requested 12 previous loans through Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to replace stock in her cafe such as cartons of drinking water. Halima has successfully repaid her previous loans and was able to buy a plot of land and pay school fees and household expenses. 

Halima will share her loan with her loan group, “Mt. Livingstone,” which has 20 members. The members each hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. Halima will use her portion of the loan to restock items missing in her café. In the future, she hopes to build a nice family house.

loans.use: to restock water, soft drinks, and food at her café

loans.name: Safiatu

texts.en: Safiatu is 29 years old, married and the mother of two children who are 3 and 5 years old. She earns an income by selling food in the Jui area east of Freetown. She began her business as a way to improve her family's living conditions. She's been in this business for nine years and sells gari salad and chicken out of her home. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more gari, cooking oil and mayonnaise. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children and expand her business. In the future, she would like to continue expanding her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gari, cooking oil and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Yeanoh

texts.en:
Yeanoh is 40 years old and married with five children, ages 8 years through 20 years. She runs a food business in Jui, in the eastern area of Freetown. 

To earn a living, she sells cake within her environment and has been in this business for ten years.  She says that the main challenges to her business are the lack of finances to run a big business and a proper business location.

Yeanoh requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy cooking oil, flour and sugar to prepare the cake. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her take care of her family and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour and sugar to prepare the cake.

loans.name: Wakorintho Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her late twenties, is married with a child who is in school. Fatuma has been running two businesses. One is a cosmetics business where she sells door to door, and the other is a food (chapati) business. She has been in these businesses for a period of two years now. She works from 5 a.m. to 1 p.m. and is able to make a small profit each month. 

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use it to restock cosmetics. She dreams to give her son a quality education and to live a happier life. She will share this loan with her loan group "WAKORINTHO," which totals 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock cosmetics

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is 28 years old. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his family. 

Ruslan started his business of selling food products two years ago. Now he needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy a fridge for his shop. This will make his business more profitable because summer is ahead, and with the fridge the products will be safer. He wants to use the money from his expanded business to help his family.

In the future, Ruslan wants to repair his shop. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for his shop.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Fatmata from the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of nine and 12 years. Her children are currently going to school.

Fatmata runs a nut coal and palm oil business. She sells palm oil and nut coal. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operation area.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more nut coal and palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy more nut coal and palm oil.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 years old, single and lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. For more than two years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a farming business as another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her businesses. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Grace wants to use it as capital to start another business of M-PESA (mobile money transfer business). She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to start a new business of M-PESA (mobile money transfer business)

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos, de 54 años, está casado y es padre de 4 hijos que aún viven con él, en la casa que heredó hace 26 años. Es por ello que trabaja arduamente en sus chacras sembrando papas, ollucos, arvejas, maíz y cebada con la compañía y ayuda de su esposa, pues desea brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
A Marcos le gustan las labores agrícolas, pero sus dificultades son en los tiempos de “la helada” (clima muy frío que congela sus cultivos) donde muchas veces no puede salvar sus productos, y el otro problema es la lluvia, si es muy constante los productos se malogran.
Pese a todas esas dificultades, él no renuncia a su condición de agricultor, ya que lo realiza desde su infancia y sobre todo, vive de ello.Marcos, invertirá los S/.600 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
54-year-old Marcos is married and the father of four children who still live with him in the house he inherited 26 years ago. This is why he works tirelessly on his small farm planting potatoes, ulluco, peas, corn and barley with the company and help of his wife. He wants to provide his children with a good education.

Marcos likes farm work but has problems during the time of 'la helada' [the frost] (when the very cold weather freezes his crops), and where often he cannot save his products. The other problem is the rain, because if it is incessant his crops rot. 

Despite all these difficulties he doesn't give up being a farmer because he has done it since childhood and above all, he lives off it. Marcos will invest the 600 soles in buying organic fertilizer to nourish his fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Bidu

texts.en:
Bidu is a married man; he has one child who attends school. Bidu owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Bidu operates a motorcycle transport business. His customers are passers-by and town dwellers who he takes from door to door. He has a challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate his business. 

With the 30,000 KES loan he wants to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle. Bidu joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Maisha Zakhem Group

texts.en:
Stella is a 50-year-old married mother of three children who are in school. For seven years now, Stella, a member of Maisha Zakhem group, has been managing her life by running a food shop selling a variety of products such as rice, beans, sugar, maize, flour, etc. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.daily, and is able to earn a fair profit per month.

Stella is now requesting her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loans, all since repaid, she purchased food items for her shop and started selling tap water. Profits were used to pay school fees and home expenses. She will use this loan to restock more foods in her shop. Stella dreams of building a nice house and owning a car.

Stella will share this loan with her loan group "Maisha Zakhem," which consists of 13 members. The members will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more foods for her shop.

loans.name: Syeda

texts.en: Ms. Syeda is a 28 year-old single lady. She has been in the business of sewing for many years. She is familiar with various stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation. She used her 1st loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors with packs of needles and buttons in order to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with packs of needles and buttons for her sewing business.

loans.name: Domingo De Jesus

texts.es: Domingo de 47 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus 6 hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, con las ganacias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos de los gastos de su hogar, Domingo solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, asi como aparece en la fotografia para tener una mejor cosecha, Domingo tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena
texts.en:
Domingo is 47 years old and lives with his life partner and their 6 children. He works growing corn. He has many years' experience working in agriculture so he has had a lot of experience in the field. He is very well-known in the area and has good customers because he gets the best harvests. Therefore he sells top quality products at very accessible prices.

With the profits obtained from his sales he has managed to cover some of the household expenses. Domingo is applying for a loan that will enable him to buy seed, manure, fertilizers, and pesticides, as you can see in the photograph, to improve his harvest. Domingo is recommended for having impeccable morals, being responsible and a good payer. He trusts that he will be able to repay the debt and at the same time give his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, manure, fertilizer, pesticides e.t.c.

loans.name: Mame Bousso's Group

texts.fr:
Ces deux femmes qui froment ce groupe habitent le même quartier. Elles font pour comme activité le petit commerce. Elles sont solidaires entre elles et ne cessent de s’entre-aider.
Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Mame est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 3 filles. 
Avec le prêt elle compte ravitailler sa boutique où elle vend divers produits alimentaires.Elle va acheter 3 sacs de riz, 3 bidons d'huile de 20 litres, 10 cartons de savons, 10 sachets de biscuits, des sandales et autres produits. Elle travaille avec son fils qui gère la boutique. 
Les bénéfices obtenus lui servent à renforcer ses épargnes et à satisfaire les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group is composed of two women who live in the same neighborhood and are involved in retail business.  They stand by and always help each other.

Mame, aged 55,  is standing on the right hand side of the photo and raising her hand.  She is married and the mother of eight children, three of whom are girls.

With this loan, she is planning to get fresh supplies for her store where she sells various grocery products.  She will buy three bags of rice, three 20-liter cans of oil, ten boxes of soap, ten packages of cookies, some sandals and other products.  She works with her son who manages the store.

Mame uses her profits to boost her savings and to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy various grocery products (rice, soaps, oil, cookies...).

loans.name: Balqes

texts.en: Ms. Balqes is a 55 year-old married woman and mother of three. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband's income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business of cloth trade to contribute in the family income with the help of Kashf foundation. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She is in her 3rd loan cycle; currently she has requested a loan of Rs 25000 to buy a stock of cloths from the market in various colors and designs to attract more customers. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend part of profits on expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cloths from the market in various colors and designs to attract more customers for her cloth business.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos, dos quais 3 frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante vende roupa usada e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada para aumentar e diversificar a sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja continuar a investir no seu negócio e garantir uma vida melhor a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de continuar a apostar no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Clementina is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a merchant who sells used clothing. With the current loan she intends to purchase loads of used clothing in order to stock up and diversify her merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to continue investing in her business and to ensure a better life for her family. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is continuously investing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase loads of used clothing in order to stock up and diversify her merchandise.

loans.name: Izilda

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1 filho, que frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante vende produtos alimentares e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, cebola, óleo, refrescos, e outros), para aumentar e diversificar a sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja continuar a investir no seu negócio ampliando o seu estabelecimento comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de se empenhar mais no seu negócio e aumentar a sua renda
texts.en:
Izilda is single and has a son who attends school. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a merchant who sells foodstuffs. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (rice, onions, cooking oil, refreshments, etc.) in order to stock up and diversify her merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to continue investing in her business by expanding her store. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is working harder on her business and increasing her profits.

loans.use: to purchase goods (rice, onions, cooking oil, refreshments, etc.) in order to stock up and diversify her merchandise.

loans.name: Goncalves

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos, que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ela.
É comerciante vende produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, pedra, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e adquirir uma viatura para o transporte pessoal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de trabalhar mais e fazer crescer o seu negócio para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Goncalves is married and has three children who attend school. He lives in a house that he owns and also supports a niece who lives with him.
He's a merchant who sells various products. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, iron, sand, rocks, etc.) in order to continue building his house.
His wish for the future is to finish his house and to purchase a vehicle for personal transportation. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is working harder and expanding his business so that he can accomplish all his projects.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, iron, sand, rocks, etc.) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Juntos Unidos Iremos Al Camino Del Éxito "juice" Group

texts.es: Este grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes del grupo “Juntos Unidos Iremos Al Camino Del Éxito” los cuales son muy carismáticos y positivos. Rosa de 44 años de edad  y con tres  3 hijos, La Sra. Rosa tiene un negocio de Cabinas de Internet y conjuntamente a esta actividad ella vende productos de belleza;  El préstamo solicitado es con la finalidad de comprar nuevos equipos y así tener un negocio eficiente y también poder abastecerse con algunos productos de belleza para tener más ingresos y cubrir los gastos de su casa. La Sra.  Rosa es la del medio se distingue que su hijo la esta abrasando su hijo está con polo amarillo, la Sra. rosa A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y  diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en: This group is made up of 12 members and is called “Juntos Unidos Iremos Al Camino Del Éxito” [United Together We Will Go Down the Road to Success]. They are very charismatic and positive. Rosa is 44 and has three children. Rosa has an internet booth business and she also sells beauty products. The loan that she asked for is to buy new equipment and thus have an efficient business and also stock up in some beauty products to have more income and cover her household expenses. Rosa is the one in the middle. She can be see with her son hugging her and he is wearing a yellow shirt. Rosa hugs Kiva goodbye, saying she will meet all of the goals she has set.

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia, de 66 años de edad vive en la casa de sus padres, ahí comparte el día a día junto a su esposo  y su abrió la puerta de su casa, una de las más antiguas de la zona. Rosalia se dedica a vender productos comestibles de primera necesidad tales como arroz , azúcar , entre otros. Afirma que es una de las más antiguas y por esa razón tiene mucha clientela.  Ahora desea mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y comprar carne y frutas pues eso es lo que los clientes desean. Espera poder dentro de unos meses concretar el espacio para la venta de estos productos. Este es el crédito número 3 con kiva , comenta que durante todo este tiempo aprendió a ser responsable y cumplido, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero recibido.
Rosalia, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de sacos de arroz y azúcar, para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Rosalia is 66 years old. She lives in her parents' house. There she shares the day to day with her husband in the house, one of the oldest stores in the area. Rosalia works selling basic necessity food products such as rice and sugar, among others. She says she is one of the ones who has been doing this the longest and that is why she has a lot of customers. Now she wants to improve the infrastructure of her business and buy fruits and meat, because that is what her customers want. She hopes in a few months to fix up the space to sell these products. This is loan number 3 with Kiva. She says that during this time, she has learned to be responsible and reliable. That is why she is grateful for the financial support she has received. 

Rosalia will invest the S/.500 soles in buying sacks of rice and sugar for her store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Jorge  Geronimo

texts.es: jorge de 52 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa. Él se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar de esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Don Jorge ha tomado la decisión de solictar un credito quer le permita poder comprar: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes entre otras cosas y tambien poder mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia que es ahi donde siembra y asi tener mejores coscehas, Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos, y asi seguirle dando a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: Jorge is 52 years old. He lives in a home he owns with his wife. He grows corn and beans and with what he sells he is able to cover the expenses of his home. This is how he earns his living and how he brings home the daily bread. He is a very hardworking, honorable and responsible man. Despite the conditions he lives in, which are very humble, he works tirelessly to give the best to his family. Jorge has made the decision to ask for a loan that will allow him to buy fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, and more, as well as to improve the land shown in the photo. That is where he plants and this is how he can have better harvests. He hopes to have favorable results, since he doesn't have any other source of income. He wants to keep giving his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials and to do soil improvement where he plants.

loans.name: Carina Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Carina tiene 32 años vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella viven sus hijos y su esposo quienes la  apoyan  en  su actividad,  su negocio es venta de mercadería nueva, actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años en su comunidad donde vive.
Doña Carina su negocio lo hace de manera ambulante en varias aldeas y caseríos aledaños distribuye su producto a muchas personas con las cuales trabaja desde hace muchos años.
Doña Carina el crédito lo necesita para la compra de pantalones, camisas, camisetas, bóxer, blusas, bikinis, faldas, trajes de niños, zapatos, sandalias, etc. el impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es poder satisfacer la necesidades de sus clientes al tener más variedad de producto y así contrarrestar la demanda que tiene.
Doña Carina los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio propio, y llegar a tener una tienda mercadería nueva, como también generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor un poco su calidad de vida.




Choluteca , Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Carina, 32, lives in the southern part of Honduras with her children and her husband, who support her in her job.

Her business is selling new merchandise, a job she has done for six years in the community where she lives.  Carina works as a street vendor in several neighboring towns and hamlets.  She distributes her products to a lot of people with whom she has worked for many years.

Carina needs the loan to buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, boxers, blouses, bikinis, skirts, children's outfits, shoes, sandals, etc.  

The desired impact of the loan is to be able to satisfy her customers' needs by having a greater variety of products to counter her demand.

Carina's plans for the future are to continue growing in her own business, get a store for new merchandise, and also generate better income for herself so she can improve her quality of life a little.

Choluteca , Honduras, April 2013

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Neftali Antonio

texts.es: Don Neftali vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos el se dedica a vender collares, percheras, entre otros accesorios para perros desde hace varios años, vende de forma ambulante en los mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Don Neftali quiere mejora su vivienda construyendo un cuarto y un muro  pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para realizarlo, por eso solicta un credito que le permita poder comprar los materiales como: cemento, arena, hierro, entre otras cosas y pagar mano de obra para poder construir y que puedan vivir bien y mas seguros él y su familia.
texts.en: Neftali lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has sold collars, leashes and other accessories for dogs for several years. He sells as a street vendor in the markets nearby his residency. With his sales he is able to pay for his household expenses. Neftali wants to improve his home, building a room and a wall, but what he makes isn't enough to do it. That is why he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy materials such as cement, sand, metal rods, and more, as well as to pay for the labor costs. This way, he and his family can live well and safer.

loans.use: to buy materials to do home improvement.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en: Ms Kubra is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has had a business of ‘waan’ manufacturing (waan is a thread-like material used to make a bedstead of a wooden frame on four legs. She offers various types of ‘waan’ in different colors, and is famous for providing good quality material in her community. She is trying hard to fulfill the needs of her family members. She is also doing sewing as her part-time job. In this way, she is able to manage the household more efficiently.  It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support from Kashf foundation. She has applied for a loan of Rs. 15,000 to buy another good machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread, to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy another good machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread, to increase her sales.

loans.name: Miguel Amilcar

texts.es: Miguel vive junto a su compañera de vida y un hijo de 2 años de edad, quien es el mayor incentivo para esforzarse día con día. Miguel se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles y este año desea aumentar en gran manera su cosecha, ya que es la única forma que posee de ganarse la vida, razón por la que solicita un préstamo através  del cual puede contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de insumos agricolas como: fertilizantes, semillas, abonos asi como muestra la fotografia entre otras cosas para tener mejores cosechas así mismo para preparar la tierra. Con el aumento de cultivo Miguel tiene la esperanza de aumentar sus ventas lo que sería de mucha ayuda para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en: Miguel lives with his life's companion and a 2 year old son. His son is the main motivation for striving day to day. Miguel grows corn and beans and this year, he wants to really increase his harvest in a big way. This is the only way he has to make a living, so he is asking for a loan with which he can have the money he needs to invest in buying agricultural materials such as fertilizers, seeds, and manure, as well as other things as can be seen in the photograph. These will also be to increase his sales, which would really help to support his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: Norma integra el grupo “CAMINO AL ÉXITO” es madre soletera tiene a cargo dos hijos aun menores  de edad quienes estudian. Se dedica a su negocio de repostería lo cual cuenta con clientes fijos como panaderías y mercados expendiendo budín, leche asada, queques, que ella mismo los prepara con este negocio sostiene los gastos los gastos educativos y alimentación de su familia. Y a la vez los fines de semana presta servicios de cocinera en un club campestre. Su sueño es mejorar su casa para mayor comodidad a sus hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de material de construcción de su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA. Norma es la segunda persona del lado izquierdo viste polo floreado.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Camino al Éxito group.  She's a single mother who takes care of two minor children who attend school.

She earns a living making pastry.  She has steady customers like bakeries and markets where she sells bread pudding, flan, and cakes that she herself makes.  This business supports her family's educational and food expenses.  She also works as a cook in a country club on the weekend.

Her dream is to improve her house so her children will be more comfortable.

She'll invest the loan in buying construction materials for her home.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Norma's the second person from the left; she's wearing a flowered shirt.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso de 43 años esta casado con Lucy, la madre de sus 5 hijos. Ambos viven en una casa alquilada con 2 de sus hijos de 15 y 4 años. Su vivienda se ubica en la zona rural.Desde que era niño se dedicó a la agricultura, ya que sus padres también se dedican a lo mismo. Él es un hombre empeñoso y constante por eso todas sus cosechas son bien negociadas. Siembra verduras como: habas, arvejas, maíz, papas, lechugas, coliflor y otras hortalizas en parcelas que arrienda de dos maneras: con dinero o con sus productos.Hace 4 años que decidió incursionar en la compra y venta de verduras, las que adquiere de vecinos de su localidad o de su misma cosecha. Con la ayuda de Lucy lleva su mercadería hacia la ciudad de La Oroya, ubicada  a 1 hora y media de  Tarma. “Vender en La Oroya es bien rentable porque en esa ciudad no se produce nada, por ser un centro minero”, menciona.Espera una estabilidad económica que le permita mantener sin problemas a sus hijos menores.
Este es el segundo préstamo con Kiva, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le otorgaron pues de esa manera mejoró su nivel de vida. Razón por la que se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Alfonso, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para esta temporada de siembra.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 43, is married to Lucy, the mother of his five children. They live in a rented house with two of their children, aged 15 and 4. Their house is in the rural area. 

Since he was a child, he has worked in agriculture, his parents did the same type of work. 

He is a determined and consistent man, therefore all his harvests are well negotiated. He plants vegetables such as: beans, peas, corn, potatoes, salad, cauliflower and other vegetables in plots that he rents in two ways: with money or with his products. 

Four years ago he started buying and selling vegetables he got from his neighbors or from his own harvest. 

With Lucy's help he takes his merchandise to the city of Oroya located an hour and a half from Tarma. 

"Selling in Oroya is very profitable because the city does not produce anything being a mining center" he says. 

He hopes for economic stability so he can raise his youngest children without any problems. 

This is the second loan from Kiva. He is thankful for the opportunity to progress so he can improve his quality of life. 

For this reason he is committed to pay his installments on time. 

Alfonso will invest the 3,000 PEN ($1150) in organic fertilizar for the planting season. 

.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Ms Balqees is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been helping in her husband's furniture making business. The man shown in the photo is Balqees’s husband. They have been doing it together for many years. Over time, they have become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community. She is a responsible mother of five children and is liable to provide them with the basic necessities of life. She also provides services of stitching clothes in her community.

In order to purchase good quality wood with packs of polish and nails in larger quantity, she applied for a loan of 30,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf foundation. In this way, they will be able to cater to more customers without delay, which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. Balqees dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood, polish and nails in large quantity.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates Kiva and Yehu for their help.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 36 años de edad esta casada con Ronald y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia .El trabajo de Rosa, consiste en el la venta de  juguetes, collares, aretes, pulseras y accesorios de vestir sobre todo para las niñas. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad cerca de 3 años y desde que empezó a realizarlo siempre lo ha hecho sola. Comenta que cuando empezó tuvo muchas dificultades entre ellos la falta de convencimiento a los clientes que llegaban a su puesto, sin embargo, ahora siente que ha desarrollado mejor esta habilidad por lo cual sus ventas diarias han mejorado. Le agrada su trabajo porque su horario es muy flexible y eso le permite desempeñar también otras actividades eventuales. Espera mas adelante poner una tienda, pero por ahora desea hacer crecer su negocio con más productos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200 soles, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas.  Se compromete a ser una socia puntual con cada uno de sus pagos.Con el monto solicitado comprará diversos juguetes, collares, pulseras, entre otros accesorios para su venta.
texts.en: Rosa is 36 years old, married to Ronald, has four children, and lives in a home of her own.  Rosa sells toys, necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and accessories, mostly for girls.  She has been doing this for nearly three years and she has worked alone since she began.  She says that she had many difficulties when she began, among them were attracting customers to her, however now she feels that she has better developed this and her daily sales have improved.  She likes her work because her schedule is flexible and allows her to do other things as well.  She hopes that she will be able to open a store in the future, but for now she wants to grow her business by buying more merchandise.  She is asking for a loan of 1,200 PEN.  She is very happy to know that she has financial backing and can continue ahead with her goals.  She promises to be on time with her payments.  She will use the money from this loan to buy toys, necklaces, and other accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Ms Sughran is a 45-year-old married woman who has been running a milk-selling business with her husband for a period of about 10 years. They have 10 buffaloes in milk & 2 cows and sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. Sughran is a mother of five children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of Rs 55,000/- to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Nayyar

texts.en: Ms Nayyar is 45 years old and married. She has been running her business selling clothes in various colors and designs for a period of about eight years to support her husband financially. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to lead a decent life. By this time, she has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. Nayyar requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different clothes for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season to sell

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: rigoberto es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 5 hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra los principales granos básicos como lo son, maíz y frijol. Rigoberto desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otrosy poder darle una mejora al terreno que muestra en la fotografia que es donde siembra. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is a very responsible man with his household responsibilities because he always has been known for giving his children the best.  Currently he lives with his wife and five children.

He's very hardworking.  He always has worked happily and enthusiastically.  He earns his living as a farmer.  He grows the main basic grains, such as corn and beans.

Rigoberto wants to increase his sales, so he visited the offices of Integral to request a loan to buy seed, soil amendments, fertilizer, pesticide, and other supplies to be able to improve his plot of land, which is shown in the photograph.

He wants to have the help requested because he has no other income.  This way he'll continue putting food on the table for his household without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy seed, soil amendments, and fertilizer

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Ms. Zubaida is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for about seven years. Zubaida has three cows in milk and sells their milk to many people of her community, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk. She looks after the buffalos and performs the task of collecting milk from them. Her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. They are happily doing business together to support their family. She has three daughters and two sons; all are school-going. 

Zubaida needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy one more buffalo to increase her sales. She hopes the increase in milk production capacity will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to increase her sales.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Ms. Salma is a 40-year-old lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons, enabling her to increase revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Aminata from Jui, in the eastern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of 2 years and 12 years. Four of her children are currently attending school. In 2007, Aminata established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to create income to support the home and stop sitting at home as a housewife. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuations and transportation costs.

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more variety of clothing material. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent business location and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to open a big clothing store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more variety of clothing material.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: Ms Kosar is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been involved in the milk sales business for many years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Kosar’s husband. Before starting this milk production business, Kosar's family often lived in hand-to-mouth conditions. So she decided to support her family to provide a better and more secure future for her children. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow in milk; she sells its milk to many people in her community. Her customers are very satisfied and regard her for her honest behavior. In order to increase her sales, Kosar needs to purchase another buffalo so she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of her profit on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Ms Saima is a 25-year-old married woman. A year ago, she started a general store business in the corner of her house. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to bear the daily expenses of the family members alone. This compelled her to become a contributing hand in the family income. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market while Saima stays at the shop to deal with customers. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is school going. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health and wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy salts, biscuits and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 25 years old and single with two children, ages four and seven years. She runs a slipper-selling business in Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. One of her children is going to school. She began this business to improve her condition of living and take care of her children.

To earn a living, she sells plastic slippers around her community, going door-to-door to introduce her product. She’s been in this business for eight years. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenges of her business are price increases and slow sales in dry season.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more plastic slippers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her capital and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to open a big slippers table. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina, de 56 años, esta casada y vive junto a su esposo en su casa propia.Justina se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles , la cual es muy  visitada en la ciudad de Tarma, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus clientes lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras , pero hace un año cerró su negocio para atender a sus cultivos, pues cosechó en gran abundancia. Confiesa que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 27 años en este negocio y considera que es propicio volver a abrir su negocio. Con el tiempo, hará ampliar su tienda y la llenara de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos.Este es el segundo préstamo con Kiva, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le otorgaron pues de esa manera mejoró su nivel de vida. Razón por la que se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Justina, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de diversos productos de primera necesidad tales como arroz . azúcar , fideos , entre otros , para volver a abrir su tienda.
texts.en:
56-year-old Justina is married and lives with her husband in their own house. Justina makes a living by selling food products, and her shop in the city of Tarma is visited a lot. She opens her shop very early in the morning in the hope that her customers come to buy the things that they need. She is a very joyful and attentive vendor, as she always receives her customers with a smile and is ready to help them with their purchases, but a year ago she closed her business in order to attend to her crops and she had a great harvest. She says that what she likes most about her work is conversing with her customers. She has spent 27 years in this business and thinks that it is the right time to reopen her business. With time, she will widen her store and fill it with more merchandise in order to offer her customers a greater variety of products. This is her second loan with Kiva. She is grateful for the opportunity that was given to her to progress because she improved her standard of living, which is why she promises to make her repayments on time.

Justina will invest 3000 PEN in purchasing various staple products, such as rice, sugar, and noodles, among other things, so she can reopen her store.

loans.use: to buy products, such as rice, sugar, and noodles, among other things

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.en: Ms Muqadas is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been doing a tailoring business for five years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household with the educational needs of her children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000/- to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces in different colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand without fail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Muqadas hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Munwer

texts.en: Ms Munwer has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over eight years now. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Two years ago, when she borrowed from Kashf for the first time, she wished to purchase raw materials. Now she has requested another loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase more spools of threads and packs of glittering material in various colors. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Munwer has taken up. She has four children and she dreams of providing a quality education to them for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads and packs of glittering material in various colors.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer de 47 años de edad luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria no completada cursado hasta el 2 grado de estado civil (Viuda) ya que su esposo murió en un accidente auto movilistico dejando con ella 6 hijos, 2 menores de edad los cuales están en primaria en diferentes grados de educación, la mayor trabaja en un centro militar en la zona, los otros dos en el lugar donde ella habita y su otra hija que trabaja como cocinera. Ella se dedica a la siembra de hortaliza (papa, brócoli y coliflor) hace más de 25 años la cual aprendió por su pareja a quien agradece el enorme esfuerzo hasta su último día de vida. Sus producto es comercializado a través de intermediarios que llegan a la zona teniendo una gran reputación por su calidad, higiene y forma de trabajar; pero como toda siembra y cultivo no deja de tener riesgo siendo estos las plagas y la variación de precios en el mercado. 

Actualmente solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la siembra de papa comprando semilla certificada ya que es más segura higiénica y limpia, por medio de esto ella podrá aumentar sus cultivos y obtener una mejor ganancia del mismo.

Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno para poder construir un hogar para sus hijos y para cultivar una mejor variedad de productos para poder ofrecer a los clientes ya que de esa forma ella podrá incrementar sus ingresos y ayudar a sus hijos con sus estudios para que ellos puedan graduarse a nivel universitario.
texts.en:
Maria is a determined 47-year-old woman who completed primary schooling up to second grade. She is a widow as her husband died in a car accident, leaving her with six children, two of them underage and in primary school but in different grades. The eldest, a daughter, works at a military center in the area, two of her other children work where she lives, and her other daughter works as a chef. 

Maria has made a living by planting vegetables (potatoes, broccoli, and cauliflower) for more than 25 years. She learnt how to do this from her husband, to whom she is grateful for the enormous effort with which he worked up until his last day of life. Her produce is sold through intermediaries who come to the area for its great reputation for quality, hygiene, and work methods, but as with all crops there are still risks, such as plagues and price variation in the market.

She is currently requesting help in order to invest in planting potatoes through purchasing certified seed, since it is safer, more hygienic, and cleaner. By doing this, she will be able to increase her crops and obtain a better profit from her crops.

Her dream is to be able to buy a plot of land in order to build a home for her children and to cultivate a greater variety of produce to offer to her customers, since in this way she will be able to increase her revenue and help her children with their studies so they can graduate at university level.

loans.use: to purchase certified potato seeds so she can plant her crops

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: In the photo above is Samuel, a staff member at one of the sugar-producing companies in Sierra Leone. Samuel is a plumber at the company and has been serving this company for 10 years now. Samuels is 53 years of age. He is a husband and a father. His wife is a trader and his kids are attending primary and secondary school. In addition to Samuel’s job at the sugar-producing company, he is also a businessman. He has been doing business for 10 years now. He has requested this loan in order to invest it in his business. He will use it to buy rice and palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil) to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: Ms Ishrat is a married woman and a mother of three. Her husband is doing a business in electronics. Initially, his income was enough to meet the daily expenses but with the extension of their family their expenses increased and her husband's income was not sufficient for the purpose.  So she started the business of a beauty parlor two years ago. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. By providing her best services, she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of makeup kits, lipsticks and cleansing lotions for her parlor.  But because of having little cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 45,000. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for five years. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy more makeup kits, lipsticks and cleansing lotions for her parlor.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 36 years old and married with three children between the ages of 6 and 16 years old. She runs a fish and wood business in Jui, in the eastern area of Freetown. Her children are going to school. She started this business because she did not go to school and she was trained in business.

To earn a living, she’s been in this business for more than 15 years and sells fish and wood within a busy market area.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price increases and the slow purchasing power of her customers.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish and wood to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Mabinty from Jui, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with six children. Two of her children are attending school. 

Mabinty runs a food business where she sells fried cake, fried chicken and fried fish. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business 10 hours per day throughout the week.  Mabinty says that her business is doing well because out of the profit, she feeds her children.

Mabinty has requested a loan in order to buy foodstuff like flour, cooking oil and sugar to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her children and pay her children school fees. In the future, she plans to change her business to a provision store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy foodstuff like flour, cooking oil and sugar to expand her business.

loans.name: David

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you David, a staff member at one of the sugar-producing companies in Sierra Leone. He has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 3,000,000. With the help of this loan, he can buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets for the construction of a dwelling house for his family. David is a native of the Mayoso village. He is 45 years of age. David is married to a housewife and the couple has five children who are attending primary and secondary schools.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets for the construction of a house for his family

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Kadiatu from Jui, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married and has three additional dependent at home. She began this business because she was trained by her mother in this type of business. 

Kadiatu runs a fish business. She sells fish in Jui market within a busy market area. She has been running this business for five years. She starts smoking the fish at 5:00 am and she does not rest until the fish is dry and she takes it to the market for sale. She says that her business is doing well. 

Kadiatu has requested a loan to purchase more fish for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her relatives and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a big fish table. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto, de 64 años de edad, esta casado con Juliana quien se dedica al comercio y es madre de sus hijos. Vive en su propia casa en compañía de su familia. El trabajo de Alberto, consiste en la venta de pulseras , collares ,juguetes , entre otros. Su trabajo es de forma ambulatoria por las calles de la ciudad, pero tiene un horario fijo por las mañanas en el frontis de un colegio cerca a su vivienda hasta donde acude a diario para improvisar un puesto de ventas y atender a sus ocasionales clientes que son en su totalidad los alumnos del colegio. Lleva desempeñando este trabajo cerca de 4 años y lo hace  en compañía de su esposa. 
Le agrada su trabajo por que le permite disponer de un tiempo libre y usarlo como ella desee, Espera más adelante poner una tienda de venta de estos prodctos en donde pueda sentirse más tranquilo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado comprará juguetes, collares, pulseras y otros accesorios para su venta.
texts.en:
Alberto is 64 years old and married to Juliana, who is a merchant and the mother of his children.  He lives in a home of his own with his family and sells bracelets, necklaces, toys, and other things.  He sells on foot through the city streets but he has a set schedule.  In the mornings he sets up in front of a school near his home.  He goes there daily to set up and serve occasional customers who are all students.  He has been doing this for four years and does it along with his wife.  She likes this work because it allows her free time to use as she wants.

[Alberto] wants to set up a store to sell this merchandise and be more comfortable in the future.  He is asking for a loan of 1,200 PEN and is grateful to all those who make this loan possible so that he can complete his goals.  He will use the money to buy toys, necklaces, bracelets, and other accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Princess from Jui in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with one child age 20 years old. She began this business because she needed to improve her living conditions.

Princess runs a cookery business. she sells cooked food at home. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business from 4:00 am until 12:00 pm, every day. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.
