Princess has requested a loan in order to buy more foodstuff like bags of rice and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff like rice and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Thomas, a staff member at one of the sugar-producing companies in Sierra Leone. He has come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to apply for a loan of SLL 3,000,000. With the help of this loan, he can buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets, cements, nails, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family. Thomas is a native of the Magburie village. He is 40 years of age. Thomas is married to a trader and the couple has five children who are attending primary schools.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets, cements, nails, etc. for the construction of a house for his family

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 42-year-old married woman. Twelve years ago she started a business of milk sales to contribute to the family income. Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Nasreen’s husband is employed in a textile mill but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Nasreen has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 45000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to purchase one more buffalo. She is hopeful to boost her earnings and wishes to spend part of her income on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Zaree's Group

texts.en:
Zaree is a group leader of a three-member group. She is a responsible housewife and has three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband owns a tea hotel in his comunity which is the only source of income for the family. His income is not enough to meet the household needs so he wants to grow his business. By doing so he will be able to increase his net income and savings which will at least help him to improve the present condition of his family. To help her husband purchase tea packs, milk and chairs, Zaree has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Paksitan. 

Nasreen is a group memeber of the same group. Since 2004, Nasreen has been running a beauty parlor in her house. She has excellent beautician skills. She wants to further grow her business so that she can increase her income. She has requested a loan amount of 20,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to purchase cosmetic products like make-up kits, eye shades, facial creams, hair proteins, masks and many other products for the growth of the beauty salon. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for her business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase tea packs, milk and chairs for tea hotel.

loans.name: Rozi

texts.en:
Rozi is a 37-year-old married woman and has run a milk sales business with her husband for a period of about five years. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. She has become famous for providing good quality milk in her community. 

She is a mother of five and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She is on her 10th loan and wishes to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
This is Delfina. She previously accessed a loan that she used to buy additional foodstuff for her retail shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another Kes 20,000 loan to buy additional stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 49-year-old married woman. For the past 12 years, she has been successfully running a business of selling milk to the people of her community. Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Her husband is employed in a textile mill but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Azra requested a loan of 40,000 PKR through the Kashf Foundation to purchase another buffalo to increase milk sales. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase milk sales.

loans.name: Samba B.

texts.en: Samba is an electrician at one of the sugar producing companies in Sierra Leone. Samba has been on staff at the company for 10 years now. A native of Bendugu village, the 55-year-old Samba is married to a teacher and the couple has five children, three in secondary school and two in college. Samba has applied for this loan in order to buy building materials like ceilings, nails, paint, etc. for the completion of a house he is currently building for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials like ceilings, nails, paint, etc. for the completion of a house he is currently building for his family

loans.name: Mt Rungwe Group

texts.en:
Habiba, a married woman in her mid-40s, has four children who are in school. For a period of seven years she has been running a genge business (grocery hut) selling fruits and vegetables. Habiba works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair profit per month. 

This will be her 6th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, she managed to restock her business with more fruits and vegetables. With the profit she received, she bought a plot and covered household expenses. Habiba will use this loan to restock her genge business with more items. 

She dreams of owning commercial cattle like cows for meat and milk selling, goats, and sheep for meat selling. She would be able to do this from the plot of land she purchased. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mt Rungwe," which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her genge business with more items.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married mother of two and lives in Msambweni. She sells in a grocery, helped by her family. Naomi is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Naomi is requesting a loan of KES10,000 to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma makes a living cooking and selling delicious chapatis (traditional flat bread), and thanks to his previous Kiva loan, he has been able to continue with his business. He is a very hardworking man who is dedicated to his business and supporting his family. His wife also helps out with household expenses as she is able.

Thanks to his previous loan, Juma has expanded and improved his overall business as well as the quality of his products. He plans to use the support from this loan to purchase wheat flour, starch, yeast, eggs and other ingredients for making his chapatis. He is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, starch, yeast, eggs and other ingredients

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: La Sra. Leticia  es una persona responsable y trabajadora. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace más de 5 años y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio ya que ofrece buenos precios y da un buen servicio a sus clientes. Solicita ayuda por medio de kiva para la compra de mercancía y así poderle dar una mejor variedad  de productos a sus clientes para ofrecerles un mejor servicio. Para esta temporada quiere agregar ventas de helados ya que sus clientes se lo han solicitado.
texts.en:
Leticia is a hard-working and responsible person.  She has had a grocery store for more than five years, and her business has been growing little by little as she offers good prices and gives good service to her customers. 

She is asking for help through Kiva for the purchase of merchandise, This is to be able to offer a better variety of products to her customers and to give them better service. For this season she wants to add ice cream sales, as her customers have requested it.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Dushime Ii Group

texts.fr:
Abraham  fait partie du groupe Dushime II et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 46 ans et est marié à Jeanine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants dont 4  étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  boutique (farine, riz, haricot,) depuis   7 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (farine, riz, haricot,…)  à revendre pour  gagner plus. 

Avec le gain de son commerce, il parvient à satisfaire les besoins familiaux : les frais de scolarité, les soins de santé, l’alimentation.
texts.en:
Abraham is a member of the Dushime II group and he lives in Gitega.  He is 46 years old, married to Jeanine, a farmer.  They have six children together, four of whom go to school.

Abraham has been selling grocery products (flour, rice, beans) for seven years.

This is his second loan with Turame.  With the Kiva loan that he is receiving, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of grocery products (flour, rice, beans etc...) in order to resell them and make more money.

With the earnings from his business, he manages to meet his family's needs by buying food and taking care of school fees and healthcare costs.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of grocery items (flour, rice, beans) to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Guapuru 2012 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento GUAPURU 2012está compuesto por diez integrantes ocho mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Carmen en la foto es la primera de la izquierda que esta con polera blanca tiene 39 años, casada con tres hijos de las edades de 4  y 7 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de empanadas, desde hace ya bastante tiempo en esta  ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de empanadas , la Sra. Carmen es una cliente responsable quien trabaja con nosotros desde hace tiempo, la Sra. Carmen va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, su deseo es crecer en su negocio para así generar más ingresos ya que este es la única  actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, la Sra. Carmen se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The GUAPURU 2012 communal bank is made up of ten members, eight ladies and two gentlemen who have different businesses.  Carmen serves and the group’s president and is the first one to the left of the photograph, wearing a white top.  She is 39 years old, married, and has three children ages 4 and 7.  She has been making empanadas for some time.  She is asking for this loan so she can buy supplies.  Carmen is a responsible client who has been working with us for some time.  She will use these benefits to improve her and her family’s quality of life.  She wants to expand her business so that she can generate more earnings as this is her only source of income to support herself and her family.  Carmen is grateful to the institution for the support.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mayra Argentina

texts.es:
Mayra es una mujer joven de 29 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 3 años de edad, luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria completo y junto a su Pareja de hogar se han podido superar gracias a la dedicación en la actividad del cultivo de hortalizas (papa, brócoli y coliflor). Ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad ya que aprendió hace más de 10 años esta actividad dirigida e inculcada por sus padres la cual hasta hoy en día siguen ejerciendo. Este es el único medio de ingreso para su familia en la actualidad por medio del cual se han superado y han podido salir adelante. La propiedad que ellos trabajan es propia gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación impuesto por ella y su pareja durante muchos años de trabajo y dedicación la cual está ubicada a a pocos metros de su casa de habitación. Hoy en día Mayra junto a su pareja trabajan duro para que su hijo tenga un buen futuro, un mejor estilo de vida y tenga mejore oportunidades en la vida. Su producto es comercializado a través de intermediarios que llegan a la zona, vecinos y ellos mismos que viajan hasta la zona de comercio para su venta.

Actualmente solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la compra semilla certificada de papa para poder tener un cultivo seguro y confiable.

Su sueño es poder mejorar su vivienda, ser una productora de papa en cantidades mayores y ser la mejor de la zona en su producción; pero la prioridad de ella es ver a su hijo convertido en profesional teniendo una mejor educación y a sí mismo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mayra is a young woman, 29 years of age. She is a mother of a 3 year old son, and a hard worker who completed primary school. Together with her live-in partner she has been able to get ahead, thanks to her dedication to her vegetable crops (potatoes, broccoli and cauliflower). She has a lot of experience as she learned the trade more than 10 years ago, directed and instilled in her by her parents who are still farming. This is her family's only source of income right now, and is the way that they have been able to get ahead and move forward. They own the land where they work, located a few meters from their home, thanks to their efforts and dedication during many years of work. Today Mayra and her partner work hard so that their son can have a better future, a better lifestyle, and better opportunities in life. They sell their products through intermediaries that come to the zone, as well as selling to neighbors and going to the market to sell their goods.

Currently they are asking for help to be able to buy certified potato seeds in order to have a safe and reliable crop. 

Her dream is to be able to improve their house, to be a producer of potatoes in greater quantities, and to have the best production in the area; but her priority is to see her son become a professional by getting a better education and thus a better future.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seeds to plant.

loans.name: Celia Dinora

texts.es: Doña Celia vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra maiz y frijol con las ventas que realiza de sus granos basicos y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un credito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas, foliares y tambien para darle una mejora al terreno que muestra en la fotografia que es donde siembra sus cultivos asi como muestra la fotografia  y poder seguir con sus cosechas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Celia lives with her husband and their six children in their own home. She has been farming for several years and grows corn and beans. With her sales of basic staples and with her husband's help, they manage to cover their household expenses. 

She's requesting a loan that will allow her to buy manures, pesticides, herbicides, fertilizers, and also improve the land shown in the photo, which is where she plants her crops. This will enable her to keep harvesting so that she can get better earnings and have a better life with her family.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and improve the land where she farms.

loans.name: Carlos Agustin

texts.es: Don Carlos vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijas, Durante varios años ha trabajado en la agricultura simbra los principales granos basicos maiz y frijol y tambien tiene cultivo de pepino. con las ventas que resaliza logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Carlos esta solictando un credito para darle el mejor amtenimiento a su terreno que muestra en la fotografia y que pueda producir mejores cosechas y comprar abonos, semillas, pesticidas y herbicidas, para que pueda obtener los ingresos para mantener a su familia sin limitacion alguna.-
texts.en: Carlos lives in a home of his own along with his wife and three daughters.  He has been farming for several years and raises the basic grains; corn and beans and also cucumbers.  He is able to cover the household expenses with the proceeds from his sales.  Carlos is asking for this loan in order to be able to better maintain his land as shown in the photograph, so that he can have better harvests.  He will buy compost, seeds, pesticides, and herbicides so that he can have a better income and support is family without limit.

loans.use: to maintain his land.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José, originario de la ciudad de León, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta y elaboración de Pan negocio que realiza junto con sus hijos. Él está muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindo su primer crédito Kiva pues logro comprar materia prima que necesitaba producir pan hizo mejoras a la infraestructura de su panadería. Ha notado como poco a poco los financiamientos han cambiado su negocio. 
Él está requiriendo el crédito para comprar harina de trigo, manteca, leña, azúcar, aceite, queso y sal. Pues esta inversión le permitirá comprar a un mejor precio la materia prima y reducir un poco los costos. Siempre sigue luchando por lograr mejorar su producto y la infraestructura de su panaderia.
texts.en:
José is a native of the city of León; he works as a storekeeper selling and preparing bread. He works in the business along with his children. 

He is very grateful for the opportunity that he was given with his first Kiva loan, as he was able to buy the raw material that he needs to produce bread. He also made improvements to his bakery’s structure. He has noticed that, little by little, the loans have changed his business.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy wheat flour, lard, firewood, sugar, oil, cheese and salt. This loan will allow him to buy his raw supplies at a better price and reduce his costs a little bit. He always keeps fighting to improve his product and his bakery’s building structure.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, lard, firewood, sugar, oil, cheese and salt.

loans.name: Comfort's Group

texts.en:
Comfort's Group is made up of three women who sell second-hand clothing, brassieres, pants, towels, bedsheets, skirts, tops and fish. They are Comfort, Janet and Adjeley.

Janet is a member of the Comfort Group. She is 37 years old, single, and has three children. Her oldest child is 13 years old, and her youngest is 8 years old. All of her children are in school. 

She is requesting this loan to buy towels and bedsheets. She is expecting no difficulty in repaying her loan because this is her fourth loan with ID-Ghana, and she had paid previous loans without troubles. Her strategy to grow her business is to take this flexible loan and repay without trouble.

Her ambition is to own a second-hand clothing depot and to educate her children. 

They need a total amount of 3,000 GHS (Ghana cedis) to be able to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy towels and bedsheets to sell to customers.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Thanks to her previous loan, Asha has expanded and improved her overall business, as well as the quality of her products. 

She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase ten sacks of cashew nuts and pay for transport. 

She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of cashew nuts and pay for transport.

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali is 21 years old, married to Antony and blessed with one child who is one month old. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical expenses. 

Mwikali operates a clothes selling business, selling women and gents suits in a shop. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other clothes operators to be her major challenges. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale in her business.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 24-year-old Mariama from Jui in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of three years and five years old. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2006, Mariama established her food stand business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business ten hours per day and six days per week. She says despite the insufficient capital to expand the business, she has a desire to educate her children.

Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay school fees for her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Mariama plans to develop her business to a higher standard. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past three years, she has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. Her potential customers are town dwellers. She cites the high cost of maintenance as being her major challenge.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to renovate her family house and purchase iron sheets for roofing. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to renovate her family house and purchase iron sheets for roofing.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is single. She has received schooling to a senior high school level. 

Hilda sells cosmetics in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. She has done this for three years. Hilda uses her income for her personal general upkeep and that of her parents. 

Hilda will use the loan to purchase different types of pomade, hair relaxers, powder and body spray/perfume. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hilda plans to save to acquire a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase different types of pomade, hair relaxers, powder and body spray/perfume.

loans.name: Rita     O

texts.en:
Rita is 40 years old and married with four children, aged 12 years to 22 years. She runs a local food business in Jui in the eastern area of Freetown. Her children are currently attending school.

She's been in this business for six years and sells snacks, salad and fried rice within her community. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and lack of enough capital to expand her business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more onions, mayonnaise, ketchup and cooking oil for food preparation. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay fees for her children and increase her business. 

In the future, she would like to open a big restaurant. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more onions, mayonnaise, ketchup and cooking oil for food preparation

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! 

This is 40-year-old Marie from Jui in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of three and 15 years old. Her children are attending school. She also has three additional dependents at home.

Marie runs a food stand business at home. She sells fish, pepper and ground nuts. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She does not have any other source of income except her business. Marie says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of capital to run her business.

Marie has requested a loan in order to purchase more fish and cooking seasoning to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family. 

In the future, she plans to build a beautiful house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fish and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Juan Erits

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 23 años y se dedica a la actividad de la pesca  el vive en una isla del lago titicaca, centro turístico del departamento de La Paz donde ofrecen al público  artesanías  de totoras y en lana, la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca y el turismo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Juan va a usar este préstamo para compra de redes para usar en la pesca, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar la pesca e incrementar su capital  de trabajo, el Sr. Juan enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener una mejor producción y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando en su trabajo ya que este es su único ingreso para mantener a su familia, el Sr. Juan es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Juan is a 23 year old fisherman. He lives on an island of the Lake Titicaca, a tourist area in the La Paz department where artisans offer the public goods crafted out of large reeds and wool. The majority of the island’s inhabitants work in fishing or in tourism. 

This will be his second loan with the institution. Juan is going to use the loan to purchase fishing nets. His motivation for requesting the loan is to expand his fishing and increase his working capital. Juan has many challenges with his business, one of which is increasing production. He is going to use the earnings to continue improving his work since this is his only source of income to support his family.

Juan is a hard worker and is happy for the opportunity provided by the loan.

loans.use: purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Casa Huerta Group

texts.es: Elena es integrante del grupo “EMPRENDEDORAS DE CASA HUERTA”. Elena es viuda se dedica al servicio de costurera actividad económica le ayuda económicamente y a darles una buena educación a sus hijos que en la actualidad ellos ya son profesionales. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de tela para confeccionar cortas para el hogar. Su sueño es mejor su vivienda y seguir trabajando en lo que más le gusta. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Elena es la persona que esta agregada en la parte superior derecha no pudo estar presente en la foto grupal porque se encontraba atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the communal bank "EMPRENDEDORAS DE CASA HUERTA".  She is a widow and earns a living as a seamstress, which has allowed her to give her children a good education, as they are now professionals.  The loan will be used to buy fabric to make home curtains.  Her goal is to renovate her home and continue working in what she enjoys most.

The group is grateful to KIVA lenders for the loan.  Elena is the one in the individual photo, since she was unable to be present for the group photo as she was attending to customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make home curtains.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El Sr. Edgard, habita en una comarca a muchos kilómetros de la ciudad junto a su esposa e hijos que son menores de edad, labora para una empresa Arrocera y con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha cancelado en tiempo y forma sus créditos, agradece a Kiva y Afodenic por brindarle este apoyo tan importante para salir adelante. Ahora requiere otro préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para continuar con las mejoras de su vivienda esta vez desea construir un porche, de esta manera darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia el cual es su principal prioridad.
texts.en:
Edgard lives with his wife and minor children in an area some distance from the city.  He works for a rice company and with much effort and sacrifice has paid back his previous loans on time.  He is grateful to Kiva and Afodenic for this significant support which allows him to get ahead.

Now he is requesting another loan to buy construction materials to continue renovating his house.  This time he wants to build a porch so he can give his family, his main priority, a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, blocks and iron.

loans.name: Edwin Edgardo

texts.es: Edwin se dedica a comprar botellas platicas y latas para luego salir a venderlas a los lugares donde compran todo ese tipo de materiales con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, Don Edwin esta solictando un credito que le permita comprar por mayor las botellas asi como aparece en la fotografia para obtener mejores ganancias en sus ventas y seguir ayudando a su familia en lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Edwin purchases cans and plastic bottles, then goes out to sell them to the places that purchase this kind of material. With the sales of this material, he is able to cover his household costs. 

Edwin is requesting a loan that would allow him to purchase bottles in bulk, such as in the photograph, that would allow him to make better earnings and continue supporting his family in whatever they need without limitations.

loans.use: purchase goods such as bottles and cans

loans.name: Mónica María

texts.es:
Mónica es una joven soltera de 29 años quien vive en Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la compraventa  de  cosméticos,  eligió esta actividad por que le genera ganancias aceptables y de esta manera contribuye a la economía familiar.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,800.00 para capital de trabajo para la ampliación de su negocio.
Su sueño es contar con un local que la ayude ampliar más su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Monica is a 29 year old single woman who lives in Sololá. She buys and sells cosmetics. She chose this line of work because she can earn a reasonable income and contribute to the family’s finances.

She is requesting a loan of 2,800.00 Guatemalan Quetzales for working capital to grow her business.

Her dream is to have a location that would allow her to grow her business and increase her income to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: have working capital to grow her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de repuestos de automóviles,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo para la compra de variedad de repuestos,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para lo mismo compra de repuestos para automoviles por mayor, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha continues selling auto spare parts. She says that the previous loan was helpful and that she used it to buy different spare parts. This time, she is requesting a loan for the same purpose: to buy spare parts in bulk.

Martha feels happy and grateful for the opportunity she is given to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts.

loans.name: Sophie's Group

texts.fr:
le banc villageois a été créé le 27 mai 1997. le groupe est composé de 7 femmes qui habitent le même village et qui font toute le commerce. il est a son 31éme prêt. 
  Sophie est la représentante du groupe,c'est elle qui a levé sa main sur la photo,elle a 65 ans, marié et mère de 10 enfants dont 7 garçons te 3 filles tous majeurs.l'ainé a 46 ans et le cadet 21 ans.elle fait de l'aviculture et du commerce de boisson et de jus de fruit dans le village et dans sa domicile. 
  Avec son prêt elle compte mettre 225000f dans l'aviculture et 200000f dans le commerce de boisson et de jus de fruit a savoir( pain de singe,sucre , sachet de jus en poudre ). Elle a une clientèle fidèle et solvable dans sa localité,en plus elle crée de l’emploie pour les jeunes du village qui remplissent les sachets de jus dans des glacière pour les vendre en faisant le tour des village .
  Avec ses bénéfices elle aide son marie dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la maison.Elle aide aussi ses enfants qui sont restés dans le village et qui n'ont pas encore trouvé de travail.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois was set up on 27th May 1997, and the group is made up of seven women who live in the same village and are all traders. It is on its 31st loan.

Sophie is the representative of the group and she is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 65 years old and mother to ten children: seven boys and three girls, who are all adults now. The eldest is 46 years old and the youngest 21. She does poultry farming but also sells drinks and fruit juice in the village and from her home.

With her loan she is planning to invest 225,000 francs in poultry farming and 200,000 francs in drinks and fruit juice (that is to say monkey bread, sugar, sachets of powdered juice). She has a loyal and solvent customer base where she lives, and furthermore, she creates employment for the young people in the village who fill up ice boxes with the sachets of juice and go round the village selling them.

With the profits she helps her husband with the daily household expenses. She also helps her children who have remained in the village and have not yet found work.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens for 150,000 francs, 15 crates of drinks for 150,000 francs, one sack of sugar for 30,000 francs, two packets of powdered juice for 5,000 francs, chicken food for 75,000 francs and 15,000 francs worth of monkey bread.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is a resident of Bunamwaya Ngobe; she is  37years old and  a single mother of two children who both attend school. 
She also takes care of three dependents providing them with all their basic needs including paying their school tuition .  Nevertheless, she is also sponsoring orphans in her school by providing them with free education to give them an opportunity of a better future.

Due to her hard work, Barbara set up a preparatory school which includes Kindergarten and primary level with the aim of providing quality education to citizens of Uganda, not only those who can afford it,  but also the poor.  In the same line, she has always striven to see that the poor also get an education, basing it on God’s principle that all men are equal regardless of their social status.  This philosophy is the result of Barbara being born from a poor family with no stable source of income.

Barbara has always dreamed of and was determined to set up a Secondary  School, so that students from her preparatory school can join directly with no hastle and also the least privileged can get a chance of advancing to higher levels of education.  Through her vision there is free education for the orphans and the poor people.  She  plans to use the funds given to her to construct seven class rooms for the Primary School so as to complete the primary level education section.

Barbara  is a focused, determined, hardworking and innovative person who never gives up  until she has seen results out of her endeavors.

loans.use: To construct a seven class room Primary School

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
Alimatu is a food vendor located in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe main station.  Alimatu has never received any formal education because her parents didn’t have any hope of educating her.  She is married and has 5 children.  Her husband is into farming.  Alimatu has been cooking and selling banku for 4years now. Banku/Akple: Fermented corn/cassava dough mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste.  It is served with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish.

To prepare banku, she first prepares corn dough (maize that has been milled and left for a day) and cassava dough.  She mixes the cassava and corn dough and cooks them into a porridge-like consistency form.  To get the right consistency, she has to stir the mixture on a hot firewood stove.  The texture of banku has to be fine, but firm. 

The accompanying dish can either be any kind of soup or sauce such as palm nut soup, groundnut soup or peanut soup, okra soup, or hot pepper sauce with fish of any kind.  The most popular side dish for banku is okra stew.  

She has been assisting the husband to feed the family.  Her loan will be used to buy bags of cassava dough, bags of maize, tomatoes.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy bags of cassava dough, bags of maize, tomatoes.

loans.name: Prosper

texts.en:
Prosper is married and has 3 children.  Prosper sells male trousers and ladies tops along the streets of Likpe Bakua, Hohoe, which he has done for the past 4 years.  His wife is a petty trader. 

Prosper uses his income for the general upkeep of his family.  Prosper will use the loan to purchase different types of trouser and introduce the sales of ladies trousers and male shirts.  With the new profits from his expanded business, Prosper plans to save and reinvest into his clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase different types of trouser and introduce the sales of ladies trouser and male shirts.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Fatmata from Jui eastern area in Freetown.  She is married with 2 children between the ages of 2 month and 4 years.  In 2007, Fatmata established her soft drink business.  She began her business because she wanted to create income to support her family.  She works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week.  She says her business is doing well.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more assorted drinks for resale.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business.  In the future, Fatmata plans to open a big shop.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more assorted drinks for resale.

loans.name: Muyisa Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bernadette est vice présidente du collectif de crédit Muyisa. Entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 47 ans et mère de 6 enfants, qui étudient. Son conjoint est Technicien, conducteur de travaux de génie civil. La cliente est vendeuse des matériaux de construction. Elle s’est spécialisée dans les affaires  de la quincaillerie. Elle installe ses articles  dans un magasin. Elle commença ses affaires avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il ya 2 ans qu’elle fait ces petites spéculations. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 50 sacs de chaux, 5 sacs de ciments à marchander.  Dans le future, elle souhaiter accroitre son capital et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie grandement l’IMF Hekima pour son projet en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: The customer, Bernadette, is vice-president of the Muyisa loan collective. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, who is 47 years old and mother to six children, who are all studying. Her husband is a civil engineer. The customer sells construction materials and is specialised in the hardware business. She sets out her products in a shop. She began her business with her own capital which she was given by her husband. She has been doing this small trading business for two years now. This new loan will be used to buy 50 sacks of whitewash and five sacks of cement to sell. In the future, she would like to build up her capital and pay for her children's education. She is therefore extremely grateful to IMF Hékima for its offer of microloans for small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 50 sacks of whitewash and five sacks of cement.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Marie from Jui eastern area in Freetown.  She is married with 7 children.  Two of her children are going to school.  She also has two additional dependents at home.  

Marie runs a food stand business; she sells onions, ground nut cooking oil and cooking seasoning.  She has been running this business for 18 years.  She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week.  Her hardship in her business is price fluctuation.

Marie has requested a loan in order to buy more onions, ground nut cooking oil and cooking seasoning for resale.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family.  In the future, she plans to expand her table business.  She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more onions, ground nut cooking oil and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 24 years old. She sells different items and has been in the business for four years. With the loan, Claudine wants to buy more sugar, cooking oil and salt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, cooking oil and salt for sale.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea is age 34. She is married with two children. She has been selling various merchandise in her boutique which has been running for five years. With the loan, she wants to add more items for sale, such as toothbrushes, toothpaste and cooking oil. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more toothbrushes, toothpaste and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a fish monger at Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. She has received no formal education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a carpenter. Ruth has been smoking and selling fish for 4 years. She helps her husband in feeding the family. Her loan will be used to buy cartons of fresh fish and firewood. She intends to use the new profits from her expanded business to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish and firewood.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Isatu from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is widowed with 2 children, ages of 16 and 23. One of children is currently going to school. Isatu began this business to create a permanent source of income.

She sells local food stuff like palm oil, tomato paste, local food (ogrie) and traditional medicine. She has been running this business for 4 years. She works at the business 11 hours per day, 7 days per week within her community.  Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, tomato paste, local food (ogrie) and traditional medicine for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a higher level. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, tomato paste, local food (ogrie) and traditional medicine for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married and has six children. She has never received any formal schooling. Mary sells in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe market, which she has done for six years. Her husband is a farmer. Mary uses her income to buy things for home like food and clothes. She will use the loan to buy gallons of palm oil from local producers and to re-sell in the market for food vendors and middle men. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to  increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil from local producers.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 26 years old. She sells vegetables and has been doing this for six years. With the loan, she wants to buy more eggplant and tomatoes. She plans to use the profits from the business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more eggplant and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.es:
Virgilia es una mujer de 39 años de edad casada, luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria no completo cursado hasta el 5 grado de educación y madre de 3 hijos los cuales 2 de ellos son menores de edad y el mayor esta estudiando en la primaria. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra (cultivo de hortalizas) desde muy pequeña actividad que ella disfruta hacer ya que desde muy pequeña le gusto y agrado la experiencia. Ella no solo es agricultora si no también comerciante de su propio producto principalmente el café mismo que crece con fertilidad y seguridad por la zona donde ella habita ya que el terreno y el ambiente es propio para el cultivo. Su producto es comercializado a través de intermediarios que llegan a la zona, vecinos y ellos mismos que viajan hasta la zona de comercio para su venta. La tierra que ella y su pareja trabajan esta a una distancia de 16 kilómetros a la cual se trasladan diariamente para su debido control y mantenimiento como lo es: Limpieza, poda, fertilización y abono al mismo.

Actualmente Virgilia solicita ayuda para poder comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos de papa ya que de esta forma ella mantendrá sano y salvo de plagas y bichos sus cultivos.

Sus planes son de poder ampliar sus tierra para poder cultivar mas producto y arreglar su casa de habitación para que sus hijos puedan vivir en mejores condiciones y mas cómodos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos se preparen a nivel universitario para que sean hombres y mujeres de provecho.
texts.en: Virgilia is a 39-year-old married woman with 3 children, of whom two are minors and the eldest is at primary school.  She, herself, in spite of only having been educated to fifth grade at primary school, is a fighter.  It was her parents who taught her how to work the land (growing vegetables) when she was still very young.  She very much enjoys her work, having taken a liking to it at an early age, and is pleased with the experience she has gained.  She does not, however, only work in agriculture; she also sells her produce (in particular the coffee which grows in abundance and safety throughout the region where the land and atmosphere are ideal for growing crops).  She sells her produce through intermediaries who visit the region, as well as to neighbours and to others at the trading area which they travel to.  The land which she and her partner farm is 16 kilometres away, which means a daily journey to carry out the necessary checks and maintenance tasks such as: cleaning, pruning and applying fertiliser and manure.  Virgilia is seeking this loan to buy manure and fertiliser to protect her potato crops from pests and bugs.  She plans to extend the land she farms so as to boost production and to make improvements to her home to provide better and more comfortable living conditions for her children.  Her ambition is to see her children receive a university education which will enable them to become successful men and women.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertiliser for her vegetable crops

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Sarah from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 11 and 20 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2008, Sarah established her general store business. She began her business because she wants to be independent. She works at the business 8 hours per day and 7 days per week.  She says that her main challenge is insufficient capital to operate her business.

Sarah requires a loan in order to buy more soft drinks and to prepare her tie-dyed items to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her tie-dyes business. In the future, Sarah plans to open a big clothing business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and to prepare her tie-dyed items to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca sells frozen chicken and fish in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. She has received education to the middle school level.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a petty trader who deals in the sales of various types of food stuffs. 

Francisca has been selling frozen chicken and fish for 9 years now. She assists her husband with the payment of utility bills and also with the feeding of the family. Her loan will be used to buy cartons of chicken and fish to stock the fridge. She intends to save the new profits from her business to increase her working capital so she can acquire a new freezer.

loans.use: to buy cartons of chicken and fish to stock the fridge.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace is 41 years old. She is a widow with three children. With the loan, she wants to buy more beers and sodas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings. She is very thankful for the previous loan, which helped her family and her business upgrade.

loans.use: To buy more beers and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violette is 36 years old; she sells lady’s clothes and her husband works as a tailor. Violette has decided to sell clothes because her previous business does not make good profits now.

She wants the loan to buy more clothes to sell; the profits from the business will be used to build a house.  

The last loan helped her upgrade her previous business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Perfect

texts.en:
Perfect is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high school. She sells ladies brassieres and dresses in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe, which she has done for one year now, upon realizing that the family needs an extra income. Her husband is a tailor. Perfect uses her income to assist her husband in feeding the family. 

She will use the loan to purchase different types of brassieres and to introduce the sales of panties and children's wear. Perfect plans to save the new profits to reinvest in her expanded business.

loans.use: to purchase different types of brassieres and to introduce the sales of panties and children's wear.

loans.name: Maresh

texts.en:
Maresh is 50 years old and married with 6 children. Two of her children are going to school. She runs a food stand business in Jui eastern area in Freetown. She began her business to get a source of income and improve her standard of living. 

She's been in this business for 6 years and sells cooking oil, rice, palm oil and seasonings within a busy market area. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and lack of capital to run her business.  

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more foodstuff items such as cooking oil, rice, palm oil and seasonings. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her status and increase her business. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a shop level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff items such as cooking oil, rice, palm oil and seasonings.

loans.name: Delarah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Delarah from Jui, which is in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 20. Three of her children are attending school. 

Delarah runs a store with food items; she sells pure water and soft drinks. She has been running this business for 15 years, and she works at the business throughout the week and 11 hours each day.  She describes her major problems as insufficient capital to run her business and lack of electricity supply within the community.

Delarah has requested a loan in order to buy more pure water and soft drinks to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family and pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, she plans to open a bar and restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more pure water and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 56 years old; she is a widow selling foodstuffs, which she has been doing for the past ten years. 

With the loan, she wants add more items to sell such as sorghum, corn, and millet to the existing business. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum, corn, and millet to sell.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 29 years old. She has been running a boutique for 17 years, and sells different products. 

With the loan, she will buy more peanuts, sugar, and cooking oil to sell. 

She will add to her savings with the profits from the business.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts, sugar, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Hannah Group

texts.en:
Hannah Group is a life saver for Jangmei. She is the featured borrower member with the raised hand. She is a farmer and ploughs on someone else’s farms with her husband and earns a daily wage. The farm products at the end of the harvest are then shared with the Zamindars (the farm owners), which always leaves her family with a very small income and harvest. 

Jangmei refers to Hannah Group as a life saver because after she joined the group, she could avail loans from WSDS. She bought piglets and also constructed a pig sty at the back of her house to raise them. Now, she can raise pigs as well as continue her vegetable plantations, which eventually will increase her income. 

She plants vegetables according to seasonal changes and keeps herself busy throughout the year. She sells vegetables to women vegetable vendors and her main supply is chives. She says her main income is generated after selling chives because it can be grown throughout the year. 

After she joined the group, she could send her children to boarding schools. She could pay the school expenses after she sold her fully grown pigs. She is happy to share this and says her life has made a different turn too.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase two more piglets and raise them. She has two medium sized pigs in her sty at present and wishes to increase the numbers. Her husband has constructed another pig sty for her already. Once she gets the Kiva loan, she will buy two more piglets. She chuckles and says “Very soon, I will own four pigs in my sty.”

She thanks WSDS and Kiva as their partnership will assist financial support in her business. She wishes them both “good luck.”

loans.use: To purchase two more piglets, raise them and sell for profits.

loans.name: Sutkim Group

texts.en:
“You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.” 

This quote is Veijahat’s favourite and she says she always tries to do everything right. She joined Sutkim Group in the year 2009. She is pictured with hand raised and she is the featured borrower.

Veijahat rents a place in the town market shed and she sells various dried fish, dried-chilly and seasonal vegetables too. This includes seeds of pea, mustard, beans, cabbage, lady fingers, brinjals, pumpkin. She also takes advantage of seasonal plantation and sells vegetable seeds and saplings. She makes good money during the plantation season because almost the entire region is engaged in farming and people throng in the town market looking for different vegetable seeds and saplings. She also grows vegetables at the back of her house and sells them too. With the small profits she makes, she pays her monthly loan repayment, pays the house rent and also does household maintenance.

With the assistance of the Kiva loan, Veijahat is planning to purchase Kharif (summer) seeds and saplings. She will get the supplies from the city and sell them in the town market. She believes these will be useful for the villagers who can avoid spending extra for fares to get to the city to purchase the seeds. Veijahat says that after she received the loan from WSDS, she could manage the household expenses and save her husband’s salary for the children's education. She adds that her youngest son is pursuing his M.Phil in the capital city and one of her daughters is undergoing nursing training. “These are my accomplishments as a mother” says Veijahat.
		
She thanks Kiva and WSDS for the wonderful support shown upon her and the rest of the group members and is glad to be a part of the team and feels blessed. She also wishes a grand achievement for their future. She says “thank you, Kiva.”

The remaining group members are also very active and hardworking in their businesses. Their businesses include weaving, ginger farming, piggery, and garment selling.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and saplings to sell in the town market.

loans.name: Domina

texts.en:
Domina is 35 years old. She has been selling soft drinks for the past four years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more sodas and fresh milk for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more litres of milk and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Aminata from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has four children between the ages of 12 and 25. Three of her children are attending school, and one is in collage. She started in business to improve her standard of living. Aminata runs a general food store; she sells pepper, maggi cubes, milk, cigarettes and soft drinks. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business from 7 AM until 11 PM, seven days per week. Aminata says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation. Aminata has applied for a loan in order to buy pepper and other commodities for the store. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and pay her children’s school fees. In the future, she plans to build a big house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy commodities to sell, such as pepper, maggi cubes, milk, cigarettes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mather

texts.en: Mather is a married woman with four children. She has never had any formal education. Mather is engaged in palm oil production at Likpe Bakua, Hohoe, as she has done for a year. To prepare palm oil, she washes the palm fruits and boils them until they become soft and tender. She scoops the cooked fruit into a big mortar and gently pounds it with a pestle to avoid damaging the nut. Water is then added to the pounded fruit. The mixture of water and the pounded fruit is squeezed and filtered to get the juice out and remove the chaff. The chaff is sometimes used by the local people to light charcoal fires. The juice is boiled again and, as it boils, the fresh oil floats to the surface of the pot. The oil is scooped into yet another pot and left to cool. Palm oil is the preferred type of cooking oil, because Ghanaians like its consistency and flavor. It is used in most traditional dishes. Her husband is a farmer. Mather uses her income to assist the husband with the basic needs of the home. Mather will use the loan to purchase heads of palm fruits from the local farmers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mather plans to save to enable her enable her acquire a bigger pot for her business and also build more working capital.

loans.use: to buy heads of palm fruits from the local farmers to use in producing palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 37 years old. She works as a tailor and has been in business for one year. With the loan, she will buy more fabrics for use in the business. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for use in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.en:
Marcelline is 43 years old. She sells fabrics and has been in the business for ten years .Her husband works as a motorcyclist. 

With the loan, she wants to add types of fabrics for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Rugiatu from Waterloo 2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has four children between the ages of 6 and 20. Three of her children are attending school. 

Rugiatu runs a jewelry business. She sells bracelets, rings, earrings and necklaces. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business seven days per week and 10 hours per day. Rugiatu says that the main challenge to her business is lack of sufficient finance to operate a jewelry business.

Rugiatu has requested a loan in order to buy more jewelry to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her home. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo 2 western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has three children. She started business to be independent. 

Fatmata sells plastic slippers. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business 10 hours per day, throughout the week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price inflation.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more slippers as well as palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her family life and increase her business. In the future, she plans to have a permanent business structure. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old. She has sold food for the past seven years. 

She has requested a loan to buy more sugar, corn flour and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, corn flour and rice for sale.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric sells second-hand clothing Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. Eric received education to junior high school. He is married and has three children. His wife is a petty trader. Eric has been selling second-hand clothing for two years. He is responsible for the general welfare of his family. His loan will be used to buy bales of second-hand clothing. He hopes to use the new profits from his expanded business to save to give a better quality education to his children and to enable him take good care of his family.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Amera

texts.en: Amera is 41 years old, married, and has four children, ages 7 to 20. She runs a general store in the Jui eastern area in Freetown. Two of her children are currently attending school. She has been in this business for 15 years, and she sells milk, sugar, cigarettes and baby food in her neighborhood. She also receives financial help from her daughter. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation. She applied for this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy milk and other commodities to stock her store. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more commodities to stock her store, such as milk, sugar, cigarettes and baby food.

loans.name: Blandine

texts.en: Blandine is 55 years old. She sells salts and soaps and has requested the loan for adding more salts and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more salts and soaps for sale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 45 years old and married with 3 children, ages 12 to 21. She runs a general stock business in Waterloo 2 Western rural area in Freetown. Her children are going to school.

She's been in this business since 1991 and sells cigarettes, sweets, biscuits, and soap at her house. She describes her major problems as price inflation and insufficient finances to expand her business.  

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase cigarettes, sweets, biscuits, and soap. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her daughter's school fees. 

In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, sweets, biscuits, and soap.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 27 years old. She is married with one child age one and half years. She sells electronic equipment. 

She has requested the loan to buy more radios, phones, and accessories to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more radios, phones, and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 22-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo western rural area. She is a married woman blessed with one child, age 2 years. She started her business to help her family.

Mariatu runs a general store business; she sells soda, cigarettes, toothpaste, and soap. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She also earns income in another business of cotton sales. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price inflation.

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more general stock like soda, cigarettes, toothpaste, and soap. The extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and become successful. 

In the future, she plans to see her business change to a shop level. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more general stock like soda, cigarettes, toothpaste, and soap.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is single and has one child. She has received schooling but only to junior high school. 

Mercy sells ladies' sandals at Likpe Bakua, Hohoe, and has been doing this for a year now. Since she is responsible for herself and her child, Mercy uses her income for all their financial needs. 

Mercy will use the loan to purchase ladies' sandals in bulk and introduce the sale of children's shoes. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy intends to save and get enough working capital.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' sandals in bulk and introduce the sale of children's shoes.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Isatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has six children between the ages of 3 and 21. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

In 1999, Isatu established her cookery business. She began her business because she needs to have her daily meal. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. She says that her business is doing well and her customer rate has increase.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more rice, palm oil and pure water to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her children and expand her business. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her cookery business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, palm oil and pure water to expand her business.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. He has two children and has been doing this work for four years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'harvesting'.  His biggest challenge is 'Animal diseases.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Lelkina" and "Cheseger". He will use the loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a greenhouse.

Vincent was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Because they insure dairy cows.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'they improve the living standard of low income earners by giving them loans.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Vincent replied 'In paying school fees for my children.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Vincent owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Quintina

texts.en:
Quintina is a businesswoman with a passion to provide the best lawn service possible to her customers.  

Quintina Jackson Lawn Service has been in business for more than two years.  Quintina has more than five years of experience in lawn care and understands the importance of great customer service.  

The loan from Accion Texas Inc. allowed Quintina to purchase uniforms, gas mowers and a riding lawn mower, as well as pay her one full-time employee.  The long-term assets Quintina purchased have allowed her business to grow even stronger.  She continues to have a steady flow of clients and plans to expand by hiring more employees. 

Quintina credits Accion for helping her business grow and giving her the boost she needs to be more successful.

loans.use: to purchase uniforms, gas mowers and a riding lawn mower, and cover payroll expenses for her full-time employee.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has five school-going children. She owns a grocery shop, a business which has been running for five years. In the business, she sells foodstuffs, household goods, etc. She started the business from a self-help scheme where individuals save equal amounts and lend to one person at a time in rounds.

She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are inflation and bad debts. 

Regina is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy grocery stock, e.g., maize, beans, rice and cooking fat. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family and pay school fees for her children. She aspires to open a mini-wholesale store.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock, e.g., maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Maqbool Group

texts.en:
Maqbool is a 30-year-old responsible and hardworking housewife. She is a mother of five children, and her husband is currently working as an auto mechanic. Maqbool and her husband have been saving money for many years to purchase a van. Her husband wants to start his own transport business. For that purpose, as a member of a two-person lending group, Maqbool has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. They would purchase the van to start their own business. This could solve many of their financial problems. Maqbool is very much thankful to Kiva.

Note: In the picture, Maqbool is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a van.

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam is an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her four children. She loves her family and claims they are her greatest strength for getting up each morning and working hard to generate an income. 

Since 2004, she has been working as a tailor. She provides stitching services in her community. Her eldest daughter also helps her in stitching up dresses. She has excellent stitching skills, and due to the money she generates, she has managed to provide a better quality of life for her family. 

Her greatest wish is to expand her business and to purchase one more sewing machine, as her number of customers is increasing day by day. However, because of having only one machine, she cannot easily cope up with all the customers on time and that results in a loss of money and customers. Therefore, she is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to invest in the purchase of a sewing machine, which will allow her to fulfill the demands of customers more efficiently and to elevate her level of income. 

With the profit amount, she wishes to start a general store business in her home to sell a variety of products, including biscuits, tea packs, rice, etc. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for stitching clothes.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 31-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and two daughters.

Since 2005, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central market. Shameem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. Her husband is a very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Saiqa

texts.en:
Saiqa is a 34-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running a barber shop for 12 years. Due to the increase in the number of customers, her husband wants to expand his business. For that purpose, Saiqa has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would purchase some new chairs for his shop. This would increase his earnings and net income. Saiqa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC.

loans.use: to purchase chairs for barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Khalida Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a 34-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She has three children, and her husband has been running a butcher shop for 10 years. He sells fresh meat, and his clients are very satisfied with his services. Because of this, his customer base is increasing with the passage of time. 

Currently, he wants to renovate his butcher shop to attract more customers. He would build one more room in his shop to add some more space as the current space is much too congested. For that purpose, as a member of a two-person lending group, Khalida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. As this business is the only source of income for her family, this loan is very important for them. Khalida would spend the profit amount on the education of her children and would make them good responsible citizens of Pakistan.

NOTE: In the picture, Khalida is raising her hand.

loans.use: to renovate her husband's butcher shop to add more space.

loans.name: Fretzie

texts.en:
Fretzie is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (or convenience store), selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Fretzie is asking for a loan worth 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, bread and biscuits, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. Through this loan, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and profit. In the future, Fretzie has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, bread and biscuits, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store, selling various goods and items like soda and beverages. Guillerma is also engaged in seaweed farming. 

Guillerma is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings and straw. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income. In addition, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and straw.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: El Sr. Wilder tiene 26 años, el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, el  es   panadero desde hace 5 años, su panadería se encuentra en la zona de Plan 3000,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Wilder utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, levadura y manteca para la elaboración de pan su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de insumos por mayor ya que es más barato comprar por cantidad, El Sr. Wilder enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener más clientela y así de esta manera generar más ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en brindar  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, El Sr. Wilder se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Wilder is 26 years old.  He makes and sells bread.  He has been a baker for five years and his bakery is located in the Plan 3000 area.  This loan is his first sequence with the institution.  Wilder will use this loan to purchase supplies like flour, yeast and butter for making bread.  His reason for requesting this loan is to purchase supplies wholesale since they are cheaper when bought in quantity.  Wilder faces challenges in his business such as having more customers and so generating more income.  He is going to use the profits to provide a better quality of life for his family.  Wilder feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to purchase goods like flour and butter.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a married woman and the mother of two children from Talibon, Bohol. Cecelia is engaged in a food vending business selling home cooked foods to the people in her place. Her husband is engaged in a tricycle transport business. These are the sources of their income.

Cecelia is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables and cooking oil, and to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle. Through this loan, they will be able to improve their earnings thus allowing them to meet their daily needs, especially for the schooling of their children.
