loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables and cooking oil, and to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Crisologia

texts.en:
Crisologia is a married woman and the mother of five children from Talibon, Bohol. Crisologia has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 20 years now. Her husband works as a farmer.

Crisologia is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her business and makes it a success.  Moreover, she dreams of expanding her business and exploring another venture to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Egleceria

texts.en:
Egleceria is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of ten children. They live in Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 5 years now together with her husband. Her husband is a fisherman.

Egleceria is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat. Through this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Egleceria hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Corina Arely

texts.es: Doña Corina vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos de 21, 18 y 10 años de edad ella se dedica a vender perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoos, entre otras cosas con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella necesita manadar hacer dos puertas para los cuartos de sus dos hijos mayores pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder hacerlo por eso doña Corina solicita un credito para poder comprar materiales como: hierro, laminas, chapas entre otras cosas y pagar mano de obra para poder hacerle las puertas a los cuartos.
texts.en: Corina lives in her own home with her three children of 21, 18 and 10.  She sells perfume, lotions, creams and shampoo, among other things and, with  her earnings, she manages to cover her household expenses. She needs to have two doors made for her elder sons' bedrooms but, since she cannot do this with what she earns, Corina is applying for a loan to buy materials such as: iron, plastic and metal sheeting, among other things and to pay the workers who will put the bedroom doors on for her.

loans.use: to buy materials to make two doors for her house

loans.name: Josepino

texts.en:
Josepino is a 44-year-old fisherman from the town of Getafe, Bohol. He is a married man and has eight children.

Josepino has been in the fishing business for more than six years now. This is the source of his income. 

Josepino is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat and nets. Through this, he will be able to improve his business, make it a success, and be sustainable. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children. Josepino dreams of expanding his venture, in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and nets.

loans.name: Chepkoech

texts.en:
Chepkoech lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. She has 1 child and has been doing this work for 5 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and crops. She stated what is most enjoyable about farming -- the 'profit benefit, like milk for the family.' Her biggest challenge is 'raising funds.' She will use the loan to buy poultry.

Chepkoech was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that it was the 'quick loan processing.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'You offer loans to farmers.' Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Chepkoech replied that her family will be able to improve their livelihood.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Chepkoech owns a cow, poultry, pump, and bicycle but does not own a pig, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, running water, a TV, and DVDs but does not have solar power or a sewing machine. 

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of six grown-up children from Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in a financing business for more than 5 years now. She is also involved in a rent-a-car business.

Bebiana needs a loan for the expansion of her ventures. She is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the car, and as additional capital for her financing business. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success. In the future, Bebiana dreams of experiencing a good life together with her family.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the car and as additional capital for her financing business

loans.name: Helaria

texts.en:
Helaria is engaged in a copra-making business. She lives with her family in Talibon, Bohol. Helaria has been in the business for more than five years now. 

Helaria is asking for a loan to buy more coconuts for copra-making. In the future, Helaria has hopes of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for copra making

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.

 Irene is asking for a loan to buy nets and lead weights and a flashlight. With these, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Irene dreams of expanding their business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family and for the school expenses of their children.

loans.use: to buy nets and lead weights and a flashlight

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet runs a 'carenderia' or eatery in her place in Talibon, Bohol. She sells home-cooked foods to the people in her community. She is a married woman and has four children.

Janet is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasonings and cooking oil. With these, she will be able to cook and sell more thus augmenting her sales and profit. Janet dreams of improving her business so that she can cater for more customers and diners.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasonings and cooking oil

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is a 27-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a food vending business, selling home cooked snack foods to the people in her place. Josefa is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, milk, margarine, cooking oil and food wrappers. With these, she will be to cook and sell more, thus augmenting her sales and income. Josefa has hopes of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk, margarine, cooking oil and food wrappers

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 30-year-old farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the rice farming business for more than eight years now. This has been the source of her income.

 Josefina is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her farm and eventually her harvest. In the future, Josefina has hopes of making her farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en: Carlito is a fisherman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and the father of five children. Carlito has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 25 years now. This is the source of his income. Carlito is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and buckets. Through this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, like fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and buckets

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a farmer and a food vendor from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two children. Marilyn is also engaged in a fishing business. 

Marilyn is asking to buy fishing nets. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her fishing business. In the future, Marilyn hopes of expanding her ventures in order to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Kusema

texts.en:
Kusema lives outside of Kwale town, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Kusema has been farming for six years and is currently growing eucalyptus trees. He is excited to work with Honey Care Africa because he enjoys the training sessions and the chance to learn about beekeeping and he is happy to start beekeeping because it is a good source of income. 

This is Kusema's first loan and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to start more tree plantations. Kusema is working very hard these days and for good reason: when asked about his hopes and dreams for the future, he said he intends to "raise funds to pay the dowry, so I can marry my girlfriend."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than two years now. 

Marjorie is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of her fishing boat. Through this loan, she will be able to improve their fishing venture, thus augmenting their income and profit. In the future, Marjorie dreams of experiencing fullness of life with her family.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Floridalma

texts.es:
La  Señora Floridalma, de 40 años, vive, con sus hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10  años a la venta de abarrotería en general.
Doña Floridalma  vende de lunes a domingo y sus clientes son sus vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan.
Doña Floridalma está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de  mas productos alimenticios como refrescos, jugos, malteadas, leches, quesos, huevos, arroz, frijoles, pan, galletas, aceite, papel higiénico, pollo, embutidos, pastas de tomate, espaguetis, etc.  Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende incrementar más  su inventario y también el volumen de sus ventas.
Doña Floridalma su sueño es poder graduar a sus dos hijos para que puedan obtener título universitario.

San Lorenzo, Honduras –Abril del 2013.
texts.en:
Señora Floridalma is 40 years old and lives with her children in her home in the community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.  She has made her living for the last ten years selling general grocery items. 
Doña Floridalma's business is open from Monday to Sunday.  Her customers are neighbors and friends who stop by on a daily basis.  
Doña Floridalma is requesting the loan to purchase more food products like sodas, juice, malts, milk, cheese, eggs, rice, beans, bread, cookies, cooking oil, toilet paper, chicken, cold cuts, tomato sauce, spaghetti etc.  With the help of this loan, she plans to increase her inventory and also her sales volume. 
Doña Floridalma's dream is to see her two children graduate and obtain university degrees.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras –April, 2013.

loans.use: with the purchase of sodas, juices, malts, milks, cheese, eggs, rice, beans, bread, cookies, cooking oil, toilet paper, chicken, cold cuts, tomato sauce, spaghetti etc, for her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in the farming business for more than six years now. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Judith is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest from it. Judith believes that through hard work and perseverance she will be able to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a farmer from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two children. Liza  has been engaged in the farming business for more than seven years now. Her husband is also a farmer. Liza works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

 She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor. Through this loan, she will be able to improve their farm and eventually their harvest. In the future, Liza has hopes of expanding their business in order to generate more revenue necessary for their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 27-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. In an effort to support his family, Mohammed set up a metal shop business in a strategic area. He started his business by working hard with his father for many years. 

His business has gradually grown, thanks to his great discipline and responsibility. He is able to attract customers because he is a professional at making different shapes of windows in aluminum. 

Presently Mohammed is applying for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy aluminum items, which will allow him to expand his business. His investment will be successful because he has a lot of experience. 

In the future, Mohammed hopes to expand his business and establish another aluminum workshop in order to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy aluminum items, which will allow him to expand his business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 58-year-old married woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She is also involved in a seashell-buying venture. 

Leonora is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries. Through this, she will be able to improve her sales and income. In the future, Leonora has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Nikolay

texts.en:
Nikolay is 32 years old. He is married and has two children. The second child was born just recently. 

Nikolay wants to make repairs to his children’s bedroom. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 UAH.
 
Nikolay works at a public railroad. He is a driver’s assistant. Nikolay has a fixed income. He is hardworking, responsible and sincere.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his children's bedroom.

loans.name: Baba

texts.en:
Meet Baba, a staff member at one of the sugar-producing companies in Sierra Leone. Baba is a plumber at the company; he has been on staff at the company for 10 years now. A native of Magbelleh village, 58-year-old Baba is married to a trader, and the couple has seven children – two in primary school, three in secondary school and two in college. 

In addition to being a plumber at this company, Baba is also a farmer. He has been a farmer for 15 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy rice seeds to plant on his farm.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to plant on his farm

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business in her place in Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has three children. Maribel has been in the business for more than three years now. Her husband is a fisherman.

Maribel is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, sodas and beverages, and to pay the school fees for her children.

In the future, Maribel has hopes of making her business a success and continuing to send her children to school. She dreams of seeing them as professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, sodas and beverages and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes for the summer season.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 33-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. For six years he has been selling maize, and he also earns a salary from the government as a teacher. Like most good fathers he desires to educate his children up to university and to build a good residential house for them.

Price fluctuations and inadequate capital hinder his business growth, while his desire is to trade on wholesale. Denis intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim lives outside of Kwale town, in Kwale county.  Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfall makes farming difficult and contributes to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food: from wild mangrove forest and local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives. 

Salim is married and has four children. He has been farming for eight years, and is currently growing passion fruit on his land. He is excited to work with Honey Care Africa because their hive technicians give very good service and teach people about beekeeping. He is also very interested in beekeeping because he has heard that bee pollination will have a very positive on his passion fruit crops. 

This is Salim's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to pay his children's school fees. In the future, he hopes to continue to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Mwapiri

texts.en:
Mwapiri is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with seven children, and only three of them attend school. She has operating a food stall for five years and with the profits she has been able to pay school fees for her children. She began the business to supplement her farming activities and the business has been very lucrative despite challenges of unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation.

Mwapiri's dream is to have a food store that can sustainably supply her customers all year round. Mwapiri intends to use the loan to buy food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: John K.

texts.en:
John is a 25-year-old male who has been working as a welder for nine years at a sugar company in the town of Magburaka in the Northern Province of Sierra Leone. At the same time, he has been running a small business selling palm oil and rice for over five years. John’s wife is also a trader and helps with this business.

John and his wife have three children, two of whom are attending primary school and one who is not of school age yet. Since the family’s livelihood depends on generating income through the efforts of both his wife and himself, John is requesting a loan of SLL 1,200,000 from Salone Microfinance Trust, a Kiva partner in Sierra Leone.

Using this loan, John will purchase additional bulk products of palm oil and rice to sell in the local markets. Additionally, John will be able to repay his loan through automatic payroll deduction, a service provided through SMT’s partnership with his employer, the sugar company.

loans.use: to purchase additional bulk products of palm oil and rice to sell in the local markets

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: Don Jose de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa. El posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que el realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; él es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo responsable y honesto, Don jose esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, botones, ziperes y todo lo relacioando con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi el y su esposa puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Don Jose is 57-years old and lives in his own home with his wife.  He has a sewing workshop in his residence where he makes different types of garments.  He has earned a lot of customers lately because the work he does is excellent and he sells his garments at truly affordable prices.  Don Jose is a man who is very dedicated to his work, responsible and honest.  Don Jose is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase fabric, thread, needles, buttons, zippers and everything related to sewing.  He will then be able to keep meeting his customers needs and he and his wife will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, zippers, buttons, needles, thread etc.

loans.name: Mwapitu

texts.en:
Mwapitu lives close to the town of Kwale in Kwale County, which is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. 

Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for the bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Mwapitu is married with two children. He and his wife have been farming for 15 years. They are currently tending to a tree plantation on their land. He is looking forward to working with Honey Care because their hive techs provide efficient service. He is also happy that his bees will help pollinate his crops.

This is Mwapitu's first loan. He plans to use the income generated from his hives to expand his tree plantation. In the future, he hopes to create a training center on his land to teach farmers from around the region about the newest farming and tree-planting techniques.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Mwawira

texts.en:
Mwawira lives outside of Kwale town, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers  in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Mwawira is married and has seven children. His land is currently dominated by natural forest, which is an excellent and varied source of food for bees. He is excited to work with Honey Care Africa because he enjoys the training sessions and the chance to learn about beekeeping. He is also looking forward to the increased income from his beehives.

This is Mwawira's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his beehives to pay his children's school fees. In the future, Mwawira hopes to save up enough money to build his family a new house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers  in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Samuel has is married and has three children. Both he and his wife farm, and are currently growing sweet potatoes on their land. He is looking forward to starting beekeeping because it is a good source of income, and he likes working with Honey Care because their Hive Technicians are very industrious and knowledgeable about bees. 

This is Samuel's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his beehives to buy even more hives. In the future, Samuel hopes to improve his crop production by developing an irrigation system for his farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Asasio

texts.en:
Asasio used the previous loan to buy fishnets for fishing. He is a thirty-one-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been fishing for almost two years now but also has a motorcycle for a transport business. His hardships are customers not paying on time, price fluctuation, inflation, and high fuel and transportation costs. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is diversifying the business to include motorcycle transport. 

Asasio intends to use the money to buy another motorcycle for his transport business. His plan is to hire a rider who will be remitting 80% of the daily earnings to him.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Pictured here is Samuel, a staff member at a sugar producing company in Sierra Leone. He is a pH operator, checking the pH levels of the different products produced from sugar canes. He has worked at this company for nine years now. The 45 year old is a native of Masagble Village. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has six children – two in primary school, two in secondary and two of pre-school age. Samuel has requested this loan in order to pay fees for a house plan.

loans.use: to pay the fees for a house plan

loans.name: William

texts.en: William  is a 27-year-old married man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a farmer but also has a motorcycle transport business. Like most responsible fathers, he dreams of having a sustainable income to secure his children's future. Unpredictable weather changes and high fuel costs affect his profits. His goal is to become a leading farmer in the area and to buy a taxi. William intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seedlings to plant.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a staff member at one of the sugar producing companies in Sierra Leone.  A native of Makeni city, the 43 year old is married to a businesswoman and the couple has five children – two attending primary school and three in secondary school. Samuel has been with his company for 10 years now.  In addition to his work at the company, Samuel also sells alcoholic drinks. He has requested this loan to buy more drinks to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to add to his current stock

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en: Livingstone  is 50 years old, married and his six children. He lives with his family in Masindi, Uganda. He is a farmer and sells charcoal for additional income. His business is located in a rural area near a sugar factory which provides a ready market. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital affect his business growth. His dream is to venture into other energy sources that are less harmful to the environment. Livingstone intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 31-year-old married woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in food sales and has been in business for five years.

High rate of perishability and prolonged rains have been a hindrance to her growth. Her desire is to educate her children up to university and to operate from established business premises with preservation facilities. Agnes intends to use the loan to buy food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
Alie is 32 years old and lives and works in the town of Magburaka in the Northern province of Sierra Leone. Alie is married and has three children, two of whom are in primary school and one who is not of school age yet. 

Alie been working as a plumber at a sugar factory for the past seven years and generates additional income to support his family by selling palm oil and rice in the local markets. He has been doing this for six years. His wife also works as a farmer. Alie is requesting a loan of SLL 2,500,000 from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Sierra Leone, to purchase additional stock for his small business.

Through partnering with his employer, the sugar company, SMT is able to provide borrowers like Alie with microloans that are repaid through payroll deduction.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for his small business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Mohamed, who is 45 years old and a very resourceful husband and father who works hard to provide for his family. He has worked as a boiler operator at a local sugar company for the past nine years while also growing rice on his farm. He is requesting a loan for SLL 2,500,000 from SMT to hire workers to prepare his land for planting; with the approaching rainy season, now is the perfect time to plow the land and begin planting fields. This will allow Mohamed to create jobs in his local community while continuing to strive for a better life for his wife and four children. By partnering with local companies, SMT is able to provide borrowers like Mohamed with microloans that are repaid through payroll deductions.

loans.use: to hire workers to prepare his land for planting.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 28-year-old married woman with three children. Two of her children attend school. She sells fresh foods. With the proceeds from her business, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Inadequate capital to meet the high demand is her challenge. Her dream is to set up a food store in town. Grace intends to use the loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Pictured above is Abdul, who works at a sugar-producing company in Sierra Leone.  He has worked there for ten years and was born and raised in the town of Magburaka. He is 42 years old, married and the father of five children who attend primary and secondary schools. Abdul is requesting a loan to diversify and expand his income by investing in agriculture.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Mohamed, who works at one of the leading sugar-producing companies in the country. The 45-year-old is a native of Mayoma, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and the father of three children – two in secondary school and one not yet of school-going age. Mohamed who worked at his company for 10 years, and is requesting this loan in order to invest in agriculture.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline lives in Ukunda, a town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though towns along the beach (like Ukunda) see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Pauline lives with her three children. She has been farming for six years, and is currently growing mangoes on her land. She is looking forward to working with Honey Care because they give good training sessions, and is excited to start beekeeping because it is a good source of income. 

This is Pauline's first loan, and she plans to use the income from her beehives to pay her children's school fees. When asked about her hopes for the future, Pauline says she wants to "educate my children through to university."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: El Sr. Gonzalo   tiene 43 años tiene tres hijos de las edades de 20, 13 y 5 años, El Sr. Gonzalo   se dedica  a la   fabricación de variedad de Calzados, para cholitas, tiene su taller en la zona 30 de Agosto de la  ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia  dentro de la institución, El Sr. Gonzalo   va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de material para la fabricación de calzados como cuero por mayor y otros materiales que necesita para la  fabricación de sus calzados  y así de esta manera ofrecer variedad de calzados a su clientela, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Gonzalo   va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de material, El Sr. Gonzalo   es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada,  su deseo es poder producir en mayor cantidad y ofrecer sus productos a distintos mercados  y ferias de los distintos departamentos a nivel Nacional.
texts.en:
Gonzalo, 43, has three children, ages 20, 13, and 5.

Gonzalo works making a variety of traditional "cholita"-style shoes.  His shop is in the 30 de Agosto area of the city of La Paz.  This is his first loan sequence with the institution.

Gonzalo's going to use this loan to buy leather wholesale and other materials he needs to make shoes.  This way he can offer his customers a variety of footwear.  Gonzalo's requesting this loan to continue improving his business.  He's going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of materials.

Gonzalo is a very hardworking person and he's happy about this opportunity.  He wants to be able to produce in larger quantities and sell his products in various markets and fairs in the different departments nationally.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Edward Abu

texts.en: Meet Edward, a staff member at one of the sugar producing companies in Sierra Leone. He has been working for this company for 10 years now. Born in 1961 in the northern headquarter town of Makeni, Edward is married to a farmer and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. Edward has requested this loan in order to invest in agriculture. He will use it specifically to hire labourers.

loans.use: to hire labourers

loans.name: Faisi

texts.en: Faisi is a twenty-six-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has been in agriculture for five years and also has a side business of fish selling. She began the business to increase  her capital. She intends to use this loan to buy fish and pay workers who are pruning her cocoa plantation. Her business desire is to expand her cocoa plantation and buy a refrigerated van.

loans.use: to buy fish and  pay workers who are pruning her cocoa plantation

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Mohamed, a machine operator at a sugar producing company. The 27-year-old man is a native of Magbass village. He is married to a petty trader and the couple has six children – three in primary school and three not of school age.

 Mohamed has been a machine operator for the past eight years now. He wants a loan from Kiva lenders in order to build a house for his family. He will use the loan to buy corrugated iron sheets, iron rods, cement, boards, nails, etc.

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron  sheets, iron rods, cement, boards, nails, etc.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a forty-year-old married man with seven children of whom six attend school. He has been in  the clothing business for nineteen years, working six days a week and twelve hours a day. He also has rental houses and practices farming in order to earn extra income.

Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university and expand his businesses to new markets. 

Pascal intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is a twenty-seven-year-old woman with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has been dealing in fresh foods for three years. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the demand are her challenges, while her dream is to venture into farming. Good mother that she is, she dreams of seeing her children attain degrees even though she did not have a chance to go far in education due to lack of school fees.

Milly intends to use the loan to buy food such as maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust, is very pleased to present to you  Foday, a staff member at one of the sugar producing companies in Sierra Leone. A native of Magbass village, in northern Sierra Leone, the 35-year-old is married and has five children – three in primary school and two in secondary. 

Foday has worked in this company for nine years now. He has requested this loan in order to invest in agriculture. In addition to his work at the sugar company, he has also been an agriculturist for the past eight years now.  Specifically, he is going to use this loan to hire a labour force to assist him in his farm.

loans.use: to hire a labour force to assist him in his farm

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan is a 52-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and younger son in Tsaghkunk village which is in Sevan area. His elder son is married and lives separately from his parents. 

Vachagan and his family are engaged in farming and animal breeding in their village. He has cows, horses, sheep and chickens. Vachagan grows vegetables in his garden: tomatoes, cucumbers, and potatoes which he sells in Sevan food markets.  Dairy products, meat and eggs from his animal breeding are sold from his house to wholesalers. Profit from farming and animal breeding allows him to meet his family needs.
 
Vachagan decided to increase his animal breeding; he enlarged his barn for animals and needs a loan amount 500.000 Armenian drams to buy three young calves. He hopes to receive a good profit at the end of this year.

loans.use: To buy three young calves

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is 29 years old and comes from Jenin. He is married and has one child. He owns a car out of which he sells fruit and vegetables through driving around the whole town.

Jihad asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to do maintenance for the vehicle out of which he sells fruit and vegetables and buy fruit and vegetable to sell. He hopes that this loan will increase his sales and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to do maintenance for the vehicle out of which he sells fruit and vegetables and buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Los Bailarines Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es María tiene 29 años de edad, casada, con un hijo su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon desde hace tres años. Los productos los vende en su comunidad al contado y al crédito, invertirá el préstamo en la compra de cosméticos de la Avon como cremas faciales, perfumen de varón, perfumen de dama, crema para manos, cremas para cuerpos, champo, delineadores, etc. Jenny tiene 31 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos de la Avon y Alex tiene 29 años y su negocio es el servicio de transporte intermunicipal.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members.

One of them is María, 29.  She's married and has one child.  She has sold Avon cosmetics for three years.  She sells the products in her community for cash and on credit.

She'll invest the loan in buying Avon cosmetics such as facial cream, men's and women's perfume, hand cream, body cream, shampoo, eyeliner, etc.

Jenny, 31, sells clothing and Avon cosmetics and Alex, 29, works in intermunicipal transportation services.

loans.use: to buy Avon cosmetics

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Former boxer Karen is 28 years old. He graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, in the Department of Physical Education and Sport. Karen is married and lives with his wife and newborn child. He is the only bread winner in his family, and has to work hard in order to sustain his family.

From childhood, Karen was into sports. He was a famous boxer in Vanadzor, and has many titles and prizes from many Armenian and European competitions. But Karen was forced to leave the big sport because of injuries.

About 6 years ago, Karen started in the clothing trading business. He rents a stall in the Vanadzor clothes market, and sells sports clothing and sport uniforms. The merchandise he buys from Yerevan (a large city in Armenia) wholesale markets, and orders uniforms from sewing workshops. With the profit from his sport clothing business, Karen is able to meet his new created family needs and help his parents.

Karen has a big order from Vanadzor sport schools, and needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy a special sport uniform collection from Yerevan for reselling. Karen hopes to receive a good profit from this order, and decided to save it for his child's good future.

loans.use: To buy a special sport uniform collection from Yerevan.

loans.name: Oscar Edgardo

texts.es: Don Oscar de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 8 años. Don Oscar se dedica a vender platanos en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues es un hombre muy amable y trabajador y los vende a buen precio, por eso solicita un credito para poder comprar los platanos por mayor y asi seguir atendiendo bien a su clientela y el pueda obtener mejores ganancias de sus ventas y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Oscar, 40, lives in his own house with his wife and his 8-year-old child.

Oscar makes a living selling bananas in the market near his home.  He has a lot of customers because he's a very friendly and hardworking man, and he sells at a good price.

He's requesting a loan to be able to buy bananas wholesale.  This way he can continue serving his customers well, earn better profits from his sales, and give his family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy bananas wholesale

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 29 years old and lives with his parents in Ijevan city. Armen graduated from Ijevan State College. He is a commodities expert, but he has never worked at his profession. After graduation and military service, Armen has worked in the transportation sphere. Now Armen is a taxi driver.

At the same time, Armen and his family are engaged in farming. Armen has a plot of land in Ijevan and there he performs his agricultural business. Armen grows fruits and vegetables and sells them in Ijevan fruit markets.  Armen’s parents help him in farming. From time to time his father goes to work abroad and helps his family from the Russian Federation.

Armen decided to establish a new orchard and hopes to receive good profit after a few years as he said that he will have to patiently wait until the new trees became mature and start to give good harvest.

Armen needs a loan to buy young trees of fig, pear, apple and plum for his new fruit garden.

loans.use: to buy young trees of fig, pear, apple and plum for his new fruit garden

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is requesting a $1,200 loan to buy additional supplies for her restaurant, including meat and vegetables. She started her restaurant in 2007 and has been earning a good income from it. Flora is happy with the loan that she is taking. She wants to open a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her restaurant including meat and vegetables

loans.name: Terezinha

texts.en: Terezinha is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $1,000.  She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits

loans.name: Sokeala

texts.en:
Sokeala is 34 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a construction worker and motor taxi driver who earns about $5 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sokeala is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase bricks and pipes to build a piggery. This money will help her acquire the ability to start a new business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn a higher education. Moreover, she wants to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase bricks and pipes to build piggery

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 36 years old. She lives with her husband, son and daughter in Vanadzor city. Anna graduated from Vanadzor State pedagogical Institute as a teacher of history. After graduating Anna has worked in Vanadzor schools as a teacher of history. Her husband goes to the Russian Federation once a year for overseas work. 

As the salary of teachers is so low, Anna decided to organize history tutorials in her house. She helps students prepare for entrance exams at universities. She says that to work with pupils is very interesting but the same time a hard and important occupation. The future of her pupils depends on the results of the examinations and she does her very best to help them to receive a good result.

Anna needs a loan to buy a computer and printer. This will help her to organize her history courses more effectively.

loans.use: To buy a computer and printer

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is a geography teacher. She graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute and has a specialization in the field of history and geography. Hasmik is 36 years old and lives with her husband, son and daughter in Vanadzor city. Hasmik's husband works in a construction company in Vanadzor and both of them share their family expenses. 

For more than 12 years Hasmik has worked in a Vanadzor high school as a teacher of geography. At the same time she has two groups of five students and organized individual lessons for geography and history and helps them prepare university exams. Hasmik said that in our century it is too hard to teach students without a computer and the internet. She needs a loan to buy a new computer and printer which will help her to organize her geography and history courses more effectively and she hopes to enlarge her student groups. And the same time she will receive more profit from this set-up.

loans.use: To buy a new computer and printer

loans.name: Nath

texts.en:
Nath is 34 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a housekeeper. Her husband is a police officer who makes an income of $5 daily. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 per day.

In order to improve her family's finances, Nath is requesting a loan of $700 to run an additional business of purchasing rice to resell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store next to the police station and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to run an addtional business of purchasing rice to resell

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is 50 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

Sophea is a housekeeper. Her husband is soldier who makes an income of USD 5 daily. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about USD 5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sophea is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase cosmetics for resale. By doing so, she will generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand the business and build a new house, as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Silueta De Cristal Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios uno de ella es Ivania tiene 38 años de edad, casada anteriormente compra y vendía calzado, desde hace dos años tiene un taller de zapatería en su domicilio donde su esposo y ella los fabrican y los  comercializan en el mercado de su localidad, tiene de ser cliente de la institución siete años muy responsable con sus obligaciones. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como charol, pega, azulón, pega blanca, plantillas, suelas etc. Ivania es otra socia que tiene 44 años y su negocio es la venta de verduras frescas, pinol, pinolillo y Juan tiene 26 años de edad y su negocio es tener un taller de calzado.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three members.

One of the members is Ivania, 38.  She's married and used to buy and sell footwear.  For two years she has had a cobbler workshop in her home where she and her husband make shoes, which they sell in the town market.  She has been a client of the institution for seven years and she's very responsible with her obligations.

She'll invest the loan in buying raw materials such as patent leather, glue, felt, white glue, insoles, soles, etc.

Another member, Ivania, is 44 years old and sells fresh vegetables, "pinol" [corn beverage], and "pinolillo" [cornmeal and cacao beverage].  Juan, 26, has a cobbler workshop.

loans.use: to buy patent leather, glue, felt, insoles, soles, etc.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is taking a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (e.g., Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, Fanta), and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of USD 200. 

Jacinta is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (e.g., Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, Fanta), and biscuits for her kiosk.

loans.name: Victoria Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria tiene 40 años, casada tiene cuatro hijos de las edades de 2, 6, 8, y 12 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de ladrillos, ella vive por la zona Simón Bolivar,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Victoria va a utilizar este préstamo para compra de ladrillo por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es pedido de ladrillos que tiene que entregar y que por falta de capital no lo puede realizar, La Sra. Victoria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona existe varias ladrilleras, por ser una zona de fábricas de ladrillos, La Sra. Victoria va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas ladrillos por mayor, La Sra. Victoria se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sra. Victoria is 40-years old, married and has four children who are 2, 6, 8 and 12 years old.  She makes her living selling bricks. She lives in the Simón Bolivar zone.  This loan is her first with the institution.  Sra. Victoria is going to use this loan to purchase wholesale bricks to stock up her sales post.  She is requesting this loan because she has orders for bricks that she needs to fill but doesn't have the capital she needs to purchase the bricks.  Sra. Victoria faces challenges in her business, like competition.  The are a lot of brick sellers in the zone, as it is a brick-making area.  Sra. Victoria is going to use the loan to purchase wholesale bricks.  She feels happy about and grateful to the institution for the help they are offering her.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale bricks.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: With working capital of $ 5,000.00, Feliciana opened her kiosk selling diesel and petrol in 2002. Located by the main road of her town, where many come to buy, she earns a good income. Feliciana is requesting a loan of $ 1.200.00 to buy more stocks of fuel in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy diesel and petrol.

loans.name: Nitalinda

texts.en:
Nitalinda is 54 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Nitalinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

Nitalinda has been in this business for 8 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of four children.  She is from Talibon, Bohol.  She has been engaged in a fishing business for several years now.  This is the source of her family’s income.  

Perla is requesting a loan to buy fishing materials such as nets, hooks and lead weights.  By obtaining these items, her husband will be able to improve his catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market.  In the future, Perla hopes to expand their fishing venture to augment their income and earnings.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as nets, hooks and lead weights

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Abundia is 53 years old, married, and has nine children.

Abundia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Abundia has been raising livestock for ten years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Abundia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Sofronio

texts.en:
Sofronio is a farmer from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the farming business for more than 25 years. This is his main source of income. 

Sofronio is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, he will be able to improve his farm as well as his harvest. 

In the future, Sofronio dreams of expanding his business and making it more sustainable and successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is single, 32 years old, and residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

To earn a living, Roy is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. He has been in this business for five years. Each month he earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. 

He requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional vehicle spare parts and accessories. In 2008, Roy joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to gain access to financial services, to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. 

In the future, Roy wants to save money as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts and accessories for his business.

loans.name: Rinilda

texts.en:
Rinilda runs a sari-sari, or variety, store in Talibon, Bohol.  She has been in the retailing business for more than 23 years now.  She sells various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. 

Rinilda is asking for a loan in order to buy additional stock like canned goods, noodles, chips, biscuits, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries to sell. By obtaining these items, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, increasing both her sales and her income.  In the future, Rinilda dreams of improving her store so that she can generate more income necessary to meet her daily needs and expenses.

loans.use: to buy additional items to stock and sell.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is married.  She has six children and a husband who is a working businessman.  She runs a shop in order to generate income for her family.  She has been thinking about how to run a bigger business but she does not have enough working capital.  She felt better when she applied for her first loan.  Justina is taking a loan of 1,000 USD from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin).  With it, she will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as clothes and shoes.

She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) because they offer loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Gusvania

texts.en:
Gusvania is married and she has one child.  She runs a shop to generate income for her family.  She has been thinking about how to run a bigger business but she does not have enough working capital.  She felt better when she applied for her first loan. 

Gusvania is taking a loan of $ 600.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin).  With it, she will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags.

She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) because they offer loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags.

loans.name: Badamdorj

texts.en:
Badamdorj, 48 years old, lives with his wife and four children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on ring-fenced land. 

He has been rendering goods transportation services to local people at an outdoor market since 2000 and now he has permanent customers and an improved truck, which highly satisfies customer needs. 

This year, his daughter and elder son are graduating from university and high school, respectively. During summertime, his wife sells dairy products and meat to local people. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair and extension since his sons are growing and requiring more private space. So, Badamdorj is requesting a loan of MNT 6,000,000 to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, concrete, planks, fiberglass, foam, and gypsum walls. 

Using these materials, he can make his house more comfortable and a warmer place. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke, and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. 

The borrower is one of our reliable clients. He has borrowed six times and paid each installment on scheduled time, without any delay.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials for his house.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is 32 years old, married, and has two children, 2 and 9. He runs a retail business in Waterloo, in the eastern area in Freetown. His children are going to school. He came from a poor background and, because of that, he could not pursue his education. He has three additional dependents at home. He is very hardworking and wants to educate his children. He's been in this business for 8 years, selling movies discs and tapes and phone accessories. He describes his major problem as the absence of electric power supply in the Waterloo community. He applied for this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy a generator, music discs and phone accessories. He says the extra income from this loan will help him have a permanent business location and start a savings account. In the future, he would like to educate his children up to university and build a big house. He is grateful for your support. The items in the background are decorations of artists appearing in the movies.

loans.use: to buy a generator, movies discs and phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a petty trader who deals in the sales of paddy rice in Akpafu, Hohoe. Mercy has received education to middle school level. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. 
Mercy has been in the petty trading business for the past 20 years to support herself. Even after she got married she continued so that she can support her husband. She assists her husband in catering to their four children. 

Her loan will be used to buy bags of paddy rice from the local farmers, mill it, and sell at the local market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to sponsor her first child to further his education.

loans.use: to buy bags of paddy rice from the local farmers, mill it, and sell at the local market.

loans.name: Engelbert

texts.en:
Engelbert operates a chemical shop at Likpe Bakua, Hohoe lorry station.  He has a degree in education, is married, and has six children. His wife is a health inspector. 

Engelbert has been operating a chemical shop since 2010. He is responsible for all the financial needs of his family. His loan will be used to buy stock of different types of drugs. 

He intended to use the new profits from his business to save for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy stock of different types of drugs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married and has three children. He has received schooling to senior high school. 

David sells drinks in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe, which he has done for three years. His wife is a petty trader. David uses his income for feeding the family, paying utilities bills, and school fees. 

David will use the loan to purchase crates of different types of mineral drinks and Malta. With the new profits from his expanded business, David plans to save money, to increase his working capital.

loans.use: to purchase crates of different types of mineral drinks and Malta.

loans.name: Bruce

texts.en: Bruce is a provision seller in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. He has received education to senior high school. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a petty trader. Bruce has been selling provisions for 3 years, but realizing that his business was going down he decided to take a Kiva loan to push his business forward again. He is responsible for the general financial welfare of his family. His loan will be used to buy cartons of bottled water, toilet rolls, disinfectants and biscuits. He hopes to use the new profits from his expanded business as savings to reinvest and thus increase his working capital.

loans.use: to buy cartons of bottled water, toilet rolls, disinfectants and biscuits.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a food vendor at Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. Cynthia has never had any formal education. She is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer. Cynthia has been cooking and selling kenkey for the past six years. Kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian meal which is made with corn flour and requires fermentation in order to create its unique flavor. It is produced by cooking fermented dough of corn/maize wrapped in maize husk and steamed. Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce, soup, and stew. It is often served with meat or fish such as fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, and roasted turkey. 

Cynthia being a married woman has the responsibility to assist her husband to provide food for their the home. Her loan will be used to buy to buy bags of maize, fried fish, tomatoes and pepper. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to buy to buy bags of maize, fried fish, tomatoes and pepper.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en: Rejoice is married and has four children. She has received schooling but only to junior high school. Rejoice is a food vendor who cooks and sells waakye in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe Township, which she has done for one year now. Waakye is a very popular Ghanaian rice food. It is often eaten as breakfast, lunch or supper. To prepare waakye, she gets her beans, rice, and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans until they become tender. She adds the colored leaves to give them a reddish color. Then, she adds the rice to the bean mixture. She cooks the rice and beans until they become tender to eat. When it is tender and well cooked, waakye is served and is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (cow skin), gari, salad with pepper sauce, tomatoes sauce, fish, or meat. Her husband is a farmer. Rejoice uses her income to assist with the basic needs of the home. Rejoice will use the loan to purchase bags of beans, rice, tinned tomatoes, and a gallon of oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rejoice intends to save her profit to enable her to acquire a kiosk to sell indoors.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, tinned tomatoes, and oil.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is an alcohol distiller from Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. George has received a junior high school education. He is married and has one child. His wife is a petty trader. 

George has been a distiller for one year. He has been giving all financial assistance to his parents and pays for food and all the bills in his home. 

His loan will be used to buy palm trees. He intends to use the new profits from his business to save and get enough money to deal in the sales of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy palm trees.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Mr. Battulga is 29 years old and lives with his wife and six-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  The family resides in their small wooden house on his mother-in-law's fenced land.  Since 2008, he has been offering a taxi service to local people, using his automobile and he is quite experienced at picking up customers, driving them quickly and finding shorter routes.  

His wife has been running a business, selling clothes at a rental stall in the trade center.  As summer approaches in Mongolia, demand for clothes increases dramatically, especially for shorts, sandals, hats and shirts.  So, he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT in order to purchase summer dresses from China.  As a result, his wife can continue to run her business without worrying about a shortage of inventory.  The borrower is a very hardworking individual who wants to save enough money to educate his son at a well-ranked private high school.

loans.use: to purchase summer dresses.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a petty trader who deals in the sale of charcoal, at a market in Hohoe. Stephen has received education to senior high school.  He is a widower and has three children. Stephen has been into petty trading since six years ago. He is responsible for all the general upbringing and support of his children. His loan will be used to buy bags of charcoal to resell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save, to enable him to increase his working capital.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to resell at the market

loans.name: Sandra Aracely

texts.es: Sandra de 38 años de edad es una mujer responsable y trabajadora. Ella se dedica al comercio de tortilla y tamales de gallina y pollo desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene muchos clientes pues la prefieren por el buen servicio y por las deliciosas tortillas y tamales que ofrece, con la ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Doña Sandra solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar los insumos necesarios para elaborar sus alimentos como: maiz, panes, pollos, verduras, mayonesas, entre otras cosas necesarias y asi poder seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Sandra is 38 years old and is a responsible and hard-working woman. She has made a living by selling tortillas and chicken tamales for a long time. She has a lot of clients, as they prefer her for her good service and for the delicious tortillas and tamales that she offers. With the earnings she obtains from her sales, she manages to cover some of her household expenses. She lives in a house she owns with her husband and their two children.

Sandra is asking for a loan that will enable her to buy the necessary supplies to make her food, such as corn, breads, chickens, vegetables and mayonnaise, among other things that she needs. She will thus be able to keep giving her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy corn, salt, chickens, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for six years. In this business, he sells retail stock like fruits and vegetables etc. He is also an estate rent collection agent, a business from where he earns commissions. 

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is high inflation. 

Evans is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya Shillings to buy retail stock like fruits and vegetables. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. She is a married mother of four, most of them grownups, only two of her children are in school. She owns a farm, where she plants crops, including cassava and cereals, to sell. Her husband is also employed. She has been farming for over ten years.

She learned about Milango through an employee, who invited her to the group. She joined the group, with an aim of accessing credit to better her business operations. The main challenge she faces is harsh climatic conditions.

Rebecca is applying for a loan of 46,230.86 Kenya shillings (KES). She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. She would also be interested in beekeeping, once her income rises. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings, to be used to expand the agricultural business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children, both in school. She owns a cafe, a business which she has been running for two years. In the business, she sells cooked food.

Irene learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are inflation and bad debts. 

Irene is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy food stock, e.g. vegetables, maize, beans, rice, and cooking fat. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family and pay school fees for her children. She aspires to open a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock, e.g. maize, beans, rice, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Шабнам имеет очень трудную судьбу, так как ее муж бросил ее и 2 детей. Шабнам разведена и воспитает детей сама.  Ей очень трудно справляться с расходами семьи. Она решила организовать свой бизнес. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес с купле продажей сим карты, зарядную систему для телефона и т.п. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Difficult living conditions force a person to use all of their strength and to use existing resources.  Shabnam has a very difficult fate as her husband abandoned her and their 2 children.  Shabnam is divorced and raises the children alone.  She has a very hard time coping with family expenditures.  She decided to start her own business.  With this goal she turned to the course "Get Ahead" organized by the National Association of Business Women of Tajikistan and earned a certificate.  Now she can start her own business and become successful in this sphere.  She would like to start a business buying and selling sim cards, phone chargers, etc.  She plans to use her income to provide her children with a good education and with high-calorie foods.  She is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni for the purchase of products to start her business.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy sim cards and phone chargers to start a new business

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Eufemia is applying for a loan of 600 USD from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). Eufemia is 23 years old and runs a kiosk in front of her house. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store such as medicines. Her store is doing well, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy medicines for sale in her general store.

loans.name: Francis James' Group

texts.en:
The borrowers above are teachers a secondary school in Koidu. They want a loan of 6,300,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) to help them meet their immediate needs. Some want a loan to invest in business, some to pay their children's school fees and other school-related charges, and some to invest in a house-building project.

Francis, a teacher at the school and the featured leader of this group, wants a loan to embark on a house-building project. Francis is a 54-year-old man who is married to a housewife; the couple has 3 children, one in primary school, one in secondary school, and one in college. Francis will use his share of the loan to buy house-building materials such as corrugated iron sheets for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials such as corrugated iron sheets for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Rebecah

texts.en:
Rebecah is a married woman, age 60, and she has seven children. She has been operating a food kiosk for five years. Her customers are local residents. She faces lack of sufficient funds to run the kiosk.

Rebecah plans to use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to upgrade her food kiosk. She plans to use the anticipated profits to service the loan and improve her family's living standards. She is honest and persistent and sees her business growing into a large hotel [restaurant] in five years' time. Her hopes and dreams for her family and business are to improve the living conditions of her family and for the business to grow.

loans.use: to improve her food kiosk

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man, aged thirty years, and he has three children, aged between four and six years. He is involved in a transport business, and he plans to use this loan to diversify his investment, by opening a grocery store. He operates in a busy environment, and his customers are local residents. Paul faces the problem of insufficient funds. He plans to buy another motorcycle with the anticipated profits from using this loan. Paul is hardworking and hopes that, in five years time, he will be operating taxi transport services. The taxi business would result in higher income, translating to a better living standard. This is Paul's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to diversify his business by opening a grocery store

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman who has three children aged between four and twelve years old. She has been operating a cereals shop for seven years. She plans to use the loan to buy more cereals such as beans and maize for resale. Her shop is located in a busy area, and her customers are the local residents. She faces a challenge of insufficient funds and hopes to use the anticipated profits to open more cereals outlets.

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM; she repaid her first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) successfully. Regina is tolerant and hopes that in five years time she will have a wholesale outlet.

loans.use: to buy more cereals such as maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a 43-year-old married woman. She has 4 children whose ages range from 14 years to 25 years. Pauline describes herself as hardworking. She operates a retail store where she sells spare parts. Her business is located near a bus station, and her primary customers are motor vehicle owners and conductors. She describes her biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more spare parts for her business. Her goal is to be self-reliant within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock for her spare parts business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a banana farmer and a teacher as well. She plans to use this loan to buy a water tank so as to access clean water for home consumption. This project will benefit sixteen family members and it will take one month to be completed. Her family faces a challenge of lack of sufficient funds. 

This is Victoria's first loan with SMEP DTM and she hopes that she will be able to access clean water easily in future. She is hardworking, innovative and creative.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Franciscar

texts.en:
Franciscar, 36, is married with three children, ages between 4 and 11 years. She describes herself as a calm and respectful woman. She operates a horticulture farm, a business she has been involved in for 4 years. Her business is located near a busy market in her home town and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as crop destruction by pests.

Franciscar will use the loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy planting materials. Her goal is to buy another farm. She hopes that in the future she will become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy planting materials

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
